they somehow still left me with the power to make something awesome...So I put my reviewing pants on and sacrificed half of my 30-minute lunch break to make it over there and order and head back to the office to chow down.  I stepped into that familiar nightmare and reached for a clipboard.  I eventually found the basket of golf pencils and started the crafting of my lunch.Step 1: Select Your MealThe wraps and bowls were out, because of the brown rice factor.  The soup seemed like an interesting concept, but I was in work attire and am prone to soup-related spills and dribbles so that was out.  And so I was faced with my mortal nemesis: the Salad.Romaine itself is too bland.  Spinach by itself is too gross.  I went with the "Freshii Mix" - which it turns out is more than just romaine and spinach (I learned later I could have just checked both boxes instead, but the Mix wasn't bad).Step 2: Unlimited ToppingsNow THIS is a lunchtime option I can be down with.  Unfortunately, the selection is void of most of the really GOOD items I like in a salad - they're in the Premium section.  Also, while the Premium section offers the choice of "double", the Unlimited section does not.  I went with Broccoli, Crispy Wonton, Egg Whites, House Croutons, Mushrooms and Red Onions.  I pondered getting Sliced Eggs as well, but the whites are my favorite part, so I was set.Step 3: Premium ToppingsHere's where they get you.  They gave you a bland base of greens and you're already at $5.95.  The unlimited toppings are freebies, but nothing spectacular about them (and you can't double).  I understand that proteins are where the real flavor and filling comes from, so I went the route of Buffalo Chicken for $2.00 extra.  And then I "doubled" it for another $1.25 extra.Step 4: Choose Your FlavorI'm still trying to understand Freshii's categorizations of "24/7", "Balance" and "Splurge".  I guess the first is good "any time", the second is for "trying to be healthy" and the third is for "not trying to be healthy".  So it's pretty obvious I splurged and went with the regular Ranch dressing (not the Lite version).  I appreciated their additional option of "half", "regular", "heavy" and "on the side" - especially since the "heavy" option I chose doesn't cost any more than "half".Name at the top and gave it to the guy, who handed me the carbon copy and I took that to the register to pay.  And yea, for a salad this awesome, the damage was about $10 - but I can at least say that it was worth it.  It's almost two meals, and I'm a guy who can handle a lot of food.The croutons are gigantic, the dressing managed to cover everything I needed at the "heavy" setting, and I felt like they actually gave me "double" on the buffalo chicken which paired splendidly with the Ranch dressing.I'd love to give this place a bad review.  I love knocking down the hippy-dippy health-food craziness places.  But they let me get something as unhealthy as I could create it.  I'm still not going to give them anything higher than 3 stars because the brown rice factor eliminated half the menu right off the bat.  Freshii, I understand that you want me to eat healthy - but if you'll let me splurge on fatty dressing and chocolate chips on the frozen yogurt you sell, why can't I splurge and get plain white rice or something just as filling but TASTY like refried beans or fried rice or chocolate?This place apparently isn't as scary as it looks from the outside with walls of clipboards and a creepy-looking metal sculpture holding chips and organic candies.  Unless you're afraid of brown rice, whole grains and vegetables...

40.description: Since nothing else was open in the loop at 7:00pm, I stopped in here to get a salad. The salad was very fresh and yummy, though a bit pricey for the Centurion Salad that I ordered ($14!) The salad was a perfect size and really delicious. I looked up the calories on the restaurant's website and it was 625 calories. Not that bad for all of the various toppings on it. The salad came with a piece of brown pita type stuff, which looked and felt like cardboard, but tasted SHOCKINGLY yummy!!!  Next time, I will try a make-my-own-salad (so it wont be so pricey!!!) or maybe a wrap, given the yumminess of the bread.

53.description: I've got 10 of my colleagues in town and knowing we'd be hitting the dinners/drinks pretty heavily I promised everyone healthy lunches. So hello Freshii! I really liked their detailed website and so genius that it counts calories for you.  I asked my colleagues to make their own salad, soup, freshii bowl...and send it to me.  Um, not one of my most genius ideas because ordering 11 different types of salads, soups, etc for picky eaters was not fun! I'll admit it...i was cursing my colleagues by the time I placed the 11th order.The food was pretty yummy. I enjoyed a brown rice bowl filled with veggies and chicken. And I really liked my coworker's spicy lemongrass soup.A good, healthy option...just make someone else do the ordering if it's a large order.

30.description: I am not all that impressed with this place.  Mediocre wrap and really rude staff - really not worth the $30 that was spent for 2 lunches.  I'd go back if I had to but otherwise, I'd rather try some other "healthy" choices in this city. There is plenty to choose from.  I also read another reviewers review about a bug at the bottom of the salad and that is enough to make me not want to go back.  I am glad I read the review AFTER going.

46.description: We loved this place.  I had a "bliss bowl" which I'm sure I will be making at home.  The "spicy lemongrass" soup was hot and delicious.  Only one thing bothered me about the soup.  The small pieces of chicken tasted funny.  I've had chicken in some Chinese places that tasted similar.  I asked a server about it, and she said it was pre-cooked and she thought it was OK.  Oh, one other thing.  I place has a real healthy vibe - the Equinox health spa is connected to it.

1.description: I really want to like this place; it's one of the only healthy fast food options near my office. I've tried it three times and each time it's just been gross. It's expensive, and the food has been bland each time. I've tried different things there and left each time feeling mad that I just paid $10 for a completely flavorless meal that I don't even finish half of. Never going back.

55.description: Freshii's website alone gets 5 stars. I love online ordering, and the fact that you can create your own salad, wrap or soup on line, especially for a large company lunch order, this is awesome.When I initially made my order a few days in advance, I was stuffed, so the last thing I wanted to do was think about food, so I went for the lemon grass soup (I'm also a soupaholic). But when lunchtime came around yesterday, i sorta regretted it. I was famished. Luckily, this was no side soup. It was served in a large cup/container. I must say that it had a surprising amount of savory flavor. It had a zesty broth with hints of earthy spices and lemon. Loved it. The only reason why I knocked off one star was that I ordered mine with brown rice instead of rice noodles, along with cilantro and some other fixins that weren't included. Not too big of a deal; I still ate it all.

9.description: My second time to Freshii and first time to this location.My first time and I immedietly fell in love with the healthy meal. It's not cheap, but atleast its a healthy meal with no grease and reduced fat. And it doenst break the bank.Although I didn't like this location as much as the other location I tried downtown Chicago - the service was a bit slow takes about 15 mins to wait for your meal after you place your order.Can't wait to have Freshii again!

26.description: Not going back, sorry. The music is way too loud in there and you literally have to scream your order. Plus, it looks like IKEA and has an IKEA concept. Don't get me wrong, I love IKEA (see my IKEA review), but not when it comes to food. You have to fill out your order on a sheet of paper with a pencil. Little do you know that every time to put a checkmark next to something, you run up  your little food bill higher and higher. The food is bland and overpriced. I had two different bowls here and they both tasted very generic. There is something missing here, but I cannot put my finger on it... Perhaps they skimp on seasonings or something. Anyway, I came because I purchased a kgb deal and even then it was not worth it.The only nice thing about Freshii is that it is located in a nice building. But even the 311 Wacker location can't save that 10 dollar bowl of bland.With flavorful Panera Bread right across the street, why bother with Freshii?

25.description: If you live downtown, here's the trick:  Place your order online!  You can build your meal at your own pace, and even prepay for it.  They tell you what time it will be ready -- or -- you can schedule a pickup time.Then you just walk in and pick it up.  In and out very quickly.I've now ordered online 28 times over the past few months and have zero complaints.  And the staff at the Jackson St location is outstanding.

12.description: On paper this place looks great.  When it comes to performance, however, this place fell a little bit short.  First off, they recently remodeled the store and switched up their menu items.   While the menu isn't radically different than what's displayed on the corporate website, I was a little dissapointed that the option I was looking forward to ordering wasn't on their new menu.  Whatevs,  it seems like most people go here for a quick salad/noodle option.  I didn't think my salad was the greatest.  The "steak" in my salad was more like strips of roast beef.  It was a nice-sized salad, but for what I paid I expected more from it.  The chopped salad at the corner bakery is much better.

59.description: This place could be awesome - four stars - but it's just too confusing.  It's like they don't really want customers, or else they've never been an office worker who has a lot of options and wants healthy, but also doesn't really want to have to figure out a convoluted system just to eat lunch.They need to have photos of how the styles of prep look.  My food was okay, but I would have ordered differently if I knew what it looked like first.  They also need to greatly reduce the complexity of it.  It's great to have such total control over your food, but I couldn't tell how the system worked or what pieces went together or how much it would end up costing me based on what I picked.  I may be back, because it seems like a cool concept, but despite all the options, the system makes it more work than lunch should be.Also, since they don't have any photos when a person offers to help you, it's really hard to visualize what the heck they're talking about, so even when they try to help, it's not very effective. I don't understand how they don't realize that reworking their system, making their entrance and customer flow more user-friendly and intuitive and actually letting people SEE how their food will come out would easily double their customer base.  I walked by this for a year, even walked in several times before I tried it out because it was confusing and I'm not in the mood to deal with confusion over lunch.

21.description: We went here because it was close to the theater. Big mistake. I should have walked another way, The rice bowl was horrible and it came cold. They had no way to heat it up except to put it through the hot water net again. Then at least it was sort of warm. I;m not coming back to this overpriced place again.

17.description: I still frequent Freshii on a semi-regular basis. More often than not I build my own rice bowl with black beans, corn, sprouts, salsa, tofu, broccoli, and carrots.I've also ordered the frozen yogurt several times. It's far more fro yo than I would ever eat in one serving and the staff really seems to struggle with the concept of giving me just a half serving. (Rather than taking a full serving and throwing half away.)They recently raised the prices a bit, but the rice bowls are plenty of food for the money.  I can usually get two meals out of one rice bowl.

10.description: Great for vegetarians. Had the lemon grass soup with tofu. Great for a rainy day like today. The berry smoothie was good too.

5.description: My second time here, take out. I'm back at my desk.I'm wondering what on earth could have made this godawful bowl of noodles cost $7.76. The noodles themselves (85% of the dish) are bland, sort of like styrofoam. The veggies (which I ordered this dish for, yet only comprise maybe 10% of it), are soaked with oil and do not taste fresh or healthy. The rest of the dish is tofu, spices, and oil, none of which are that good.Wtf?? How do you get away charging $7.76 for this? The only benefit is that its filling, but I can go to, oh, anywhere for that. Maybe if this were in the $5.00 range, I'd be cool with it. Maybe if it were super fresh and healthy tasting, i'd be ok with it. But come on, this is a bland, oily mess.

3.description: I really wanted to like this place. The interior design looks modern and "fresh" and I love the idea of fresh healthy food. However, after giving it a handful of tries, I feel as if I will probably never go back. The food is just way to pricey for the amountand the quality. It is about 6 dollars for just rice/noodle with a small amount of vegetables. You have to pay another about 2 dollars  and change to add protein!  So after tax it is almost 10 dollars for a meal.

35.description: I went to Freshii for the first time today, looking for a healthy spot to grab a quick carryout lunch.  I got the warrior chicken (brown rice, chicken, corn, cilantro, onions, tomatoes, black beans, carrots tossed in a light ranch sauce) and a side of Greek Yogurt with honey.  The serving was very large (i'm stuffed right now) a little spicy and great overall taste.  Strongly recommend!

19.description: So, I have a mixed opinion here. After seeing someone with what looked like a delicious bowl of soup from Freshii (and being hungry for such) a coworker and I abandoned a visit to Haifa Cafe to try this place out. I had the Thai Chicken soup, and my friend had a teriyaki concoction of some sort. My soup was good - spicy, good noodles, good veggies. Could have been more chicken, but there was enough. I would like it more without the red onion, but I can pick around that. And it was a massive quantity of soup. My coworker, on the other hand, complained of a strange taste in his teriyaki, to the point where he stopped eating it entirely, after just a few bites. I finished most of the soup. However, later that afternoon and evening, I was physically ill multiple times. The soup was not as good the second time. Now, I don't know that it was the soup, but you know how it goes, I can't help but associate being sick with food from here. And I can't help but wonder if that strange taste was something off about the food? And I couldn't tell in my dish? Anyway. It was good, but I don't think I'll be back. I'll give it two stars out of the benefit of the doubt.

28.description: This is a rating for their salads only - Pretty average sort of place serving fast healthyish food at average-to-overpriced (for the area) prices. They don't really understand olive oil and lemon proportions too well (I had to tell them to double the olive oil). They're a bit stingy with portions of egg whites and avocado for 50 cents. A 3 dollar thing of salmon in the salad is pretty decent sized - bigger than what you'd get in a panera salmon salad. You can customize the salads and get a lot of ingredients for free but they give you tiny portions of all the 'free' ingredients. Overall I don't know any better place serving healthy food near my work so I have to live with this one until I open one of my own :)

45.description: At Freshii you can design your own wrap or bowl. A sheet of paper with a list of about 10,000 items is available where you make your selections and hand them over. In about five minutes you have basically a burrito that you have chosen to fill with beans, spinach, corn, monkey, and caviar. It took be about three trips there to mix and match enough to get the wrap just right. The selection affords the chance to get a combination of vegetable colors and is great for a vegan. The Wacker drive location is the best choice because building it is located in has a huge lawn with chairs and tables, across from the Willis Tower.

33.description: only been here once - it was a bit confusing - you can assemble your own meal or just order off the menu - i ordered their thai chicken soup and it came in a to-go jar which is kinda inconvenient...very watery and not very filling but the meal cost me about 8 bucks which about what i like to spend for lunch, not more.

43.description: I used to really enjoy this place, but the past few times have just been a disappointment, and the guy who takes your order is very abrupt and rude.  i am currently wanting to puke, as their food had made my stomach all sick and sad and angry. and last time they messed my order up, the rice was crunchy and burnt, and there was chicken in my VEGETARIAN entree. i will not be going here again.

2.description: If you order avocado.. you literally will NEVER get it. Never fails, i pay the additional 1.25 for avocado and walk out with none. I think it must be an inside joke with these people to do it on purpose.

18.description: After reading Karen T.'s review last week, I couldn't stop thinking about Freshii. It's not often that I leave the confines of River North for lunch so it better be good, I thought to myself.Since I was on a tight schedule, I printed off their order form, checked off numerous boxes to create my salad wrap and then faxed in. Easy breezy. When I arrived, all I had to do was grab my bagged wrap as I had already paid for it as well. Good thing, because my little jaunt took much longer than expected due to *sniff* public transpo. And my cheap lunch would've been marred by taking a cab (i.e. $7 wrap + $14 roundtrip car fare. Methinks not). Back to my wrap. Fresh natural chicken, crispy romaine, celery, red onions, goat cheese and a smattering of cucumber dill dressing in a whole wheat wrap. That particular dressing is lo-cal and legitimately awesome (this from someone who despises fat-free foodstuffs). My wrap was healthy according to the online nutrition calculator, filling to my tummy AND delicious as reported by my taste buds. Yes, thanks to Freshii the impossible dream is indeed possible. But, I'm pissed off because now I know how great the goods are and they're just a bit out of my reach. We need you in River North, Freshii!

41.description: Delivery. Eco-friendly packaging. Loads of options. Healthy. Yummy.Lots of great reasons to get Freshii!I was impressed with my brown rice bowl - it was exactly what I was craving on a cold snowy day. My only complaint was that I wish there were more veggies, but I did have a generous portion of salmon and for under $10 this is a fantastic lunch option!

52.description: I went to Freshii about a month ago and ordered a bowl without onions. Guess what I got? A bowl with onions. They gave me a free coupon for an entree next time I come in. I go in today, and order a Bankok Burrito to go. I get back to the office, bite into the burrito into a hard piece of metal. I looked, and there is a SMALL METAL RAMEKIN INSIDE OF THE BURRITO!! I was mortified and disgusted. Needless to say, I didn't eat the rest of the burrito. I called the store and talked to the manager who said that they would give me a free entree... again. I'm done with the free entrees. I'll pass. What next?This never should have happened. I took a picture for proof and showed my coworkers, who were also stunned. How does someone put a metal ramekin in a wrap??? Talk about negligence! This is unacceptable. If you decide to go, be sure to check your food for foreign objects before you eat it.

50.description: Somehow this slipped through my review net, so take this with a grain of salt (it's been ~6 months so things may have changed there).I used to order Freshii at least 3 times a week at my old job when I worked downtown.  The online ordering made it ridiculously simple, the massive number of options made it irresistible, and the fact that they used bike messengers who never cared that a massive weimeraner assaulted them everytime they entered the office sealed the deal on me approving of Freshii.I always opted for the wraps, and was never let down.  The things were huge, and always accurately made, with (mostly) fresh ingredients so far as I could tell.  One of my old co-workers would get the soups, and never had any complaints--and if I had to guess I'd say the soup contained at least 1.5-2x as much food as my already big wrap.The one crazy incident I had with Freshii dealt with my wrap being late...3 hours late.  When it finally arrived, it was brought to me by the manager, who apologized, gave it to me for free, and also brought along tons of tasty treats for myself and my officemates, all on the house, so really I can't complain too much.If nothing about Freshii has changed in the last six months, I'd say hit it up!

4.description: This place is the worst deal.Super expensive. Meager.  Not very fresh.  Be aware that paying $2 to add a protein to your meal will translate to less than 2 tablespoons of said protein added to your meal.

6.description: I think this place perpetuates the stereotype of food that's good for you tasting bad. Ordered the Asian Chopped salad as part of a big delivery for our team's lunch. "Salads don't need to be bland! Dressings don't need to be overly sweet and thick. Why are my wontons soggy? I need an adult!"--these are the thoughts that ran through my mind as I tried to navigate my salad. I say this because all of the non-lettuce ingredients were at the bottom of my salad. I don't understand this. The lettuce is going to make everything else soggy if it's on top. And so it did. The taste of the salad (minus wontons) was just okay. I've definitely made better salads at home. Not inedible, just not something I'd go back for.

22.description: great people work here and the food is awesome.

15.description: Freshii's website alone gets 5 stars. I love online ordering, and the fact that you can create your own salad, wrap or soup on line, especially for a large company lunch order, this is awesome.When I initially made my order a few days in advance, I was stuffed, so the last thing I wanted to do was think about food, so I went for the lemon grass soup (I'm also a soupaholic). But when lunchtime came around yesterday, i sorta regretted it. I was famished. Luckily, this was no side soup. It was served in a large cup/container. I must say that it had a surprising amount of savory flavor. It had a zesty broth with hints of earthy spices and lemon. Loved it. The only reason why I knocked off one star was that I ordered mine with brown rice instead of rice noodles, along with cilantro and some other fixins that weren't included. Not too big of a deal; I still ate it all.

57.description: I'm on a fro-yo bender, apparently...-Only size: $3.75. It's BIG. Probably a medium at most othre F-yo places. -Original is light and "flash frozen" for ultimate aeration. -fresh fruit (I had mango, which was a bit unripened) + granolaI like Freshii. I wish they were in my office building...but um, I work from home. They have fresh options, the prices aren't crazy...and they aren't so UBER healthy that they skimp out on fountain sodas. I mean, I get it Whole Foods, et al. Sodas are bad for us, but I still want my Diet Coke, so fountain it over, why don'tcha!? Freshii score. A nice little afternoon treat, and after the lunch rush there isn't a soul in sight...and you can hang out in the luxe lobby seating and enjoy. Fro-yo week has commenced...

20.description: This place is in my building, so unfortunately I go there a fair amount. Here's the thing - the food is fresh (as advertised) and (if they grilled it properly) would actually be very good.Here's the problem - I go here probably once a week and they mess up my order 80% of the time. All I get is a wrap, grilled, with no tomato. 75% of the time, the wrap isn't grilled at all (which I send back promptly because I can feel it) and a lot of the time, there is something in my order wrong (tomatoes, wrong dressing, etc.).Either the sheets they use to fill out the orders are too confusing for employees or they hire the stupidest people in the world because my order is so consistently wrong, that I had to write a review (which happens rarely). If you can, I'd recommend staying away from this place.

36.description: I still don't like freshii, but i need to update and say that the list of veggies/toppings has been drastically reduced, and most now require an additional fee (75c for sundried tomatoes, 75c for olives, etc). Oh and as much as i thought 'soup't' was a stupid name for soup, they now just call it plain 'soup' and that's kind of boring.

14.description: I've got 10 of my colleagues in town and knowing we'd be hitting the dinners/drinks pretty heavily I promised everyone healthy lunches. So hello Freshii! I really liked their detailed website and so genius that it counts calories for you.  I asked my colleagues to make their own salad, soup, freshii bowl...and send it to me.  Um, not one of my most genius ideas because ordering 11 different types of salads, soups, etc for picky eaters was not fun! I'll admit it...i was cursing my colleagues by the time I placed the 11th order.The food was pretty yummy. I enjoyed a brown rice bowl filled with veggies and chicken. And I really liked my coworker's spicy lemongrass soup.A good, healthy option...just make someone else do the ordering if it's a large order.

3.description: Not the best, but if you just want a cup of coffee I think it will do! I've never had a problem w/ the staff. But I have to admit if I order something other than coffee theres always something wrong or they give me someone else's order.

1.description: For a 24 hour Dunkin, the inside is always closed at night and there's rarely any donuts. Why is this place still in business ?

2.description: I was driving through and decided to get an iced coffee.Cashier was nice and friendly. Got my iced coffee and was in and out within a few minutes.

5.description: The employees are horrible!! They always get something wrong & then get mad when you want them to fix it. One of the girls yelled at me through the drive through. After I got my order, I had to go back and go in because of course, they didn't give me what I asked for. The same girl got an attitude, rolled her eyes, and snatched the bag out of my hand. They're rude, lazy, and ignorant.If it's not your last option on the way to work, please don't go in here!!

6.description: What a shitty place. I went in at 9:45 am seeking a bagel and hash browns. It wasn't crowded, and there was an employee standing near the register, but at least a minute went by before anyone deigned to pay me any attention. My bagel was barely warmed up, and the order of hash browns was short. I was given ONE pack of ketchup and ONE napkin with my order. JFC, take your money elsewhere; this establishment doesn't do a thing to earn it, and Dunkin' Donuts is too ubiquitous anyway for customers to endure such poor service.

0.description: Best dunkin ever! I love getting doughnuts from this dunkin the staff is really kind and quick my orders are almost always right there has been a few times that my order wasn't right but I just went back so they can fix it no big deal :)

4.description: How is it possible to give double D a bad review...uh when they make watered down burnt tasing coffee. Yes this is the place to go if you like that flavor. Not me!

3.description: I gave this place a couple of visits because one visit is never enough to gauge a good feeling for it. On weekdays it's pretty dead, with just the TV's playing in the background. On weekends they seem to regularly host private parties which means service will be pretty subpar (unless of course you're a guest of the private party). You can test out the waters on your own, but there are far better Mexican Restaurants in the area.

1.description: I'm visiting from Los Angeles and my aunt brought my siblings and I here. The food was great! I had the Arrachera a la Tampiqueña, an enchilada with Mole, chips and guacamole... ALL had wonderful flavor. I had a Tequila Sunrise and it was prepared perfectly. I loved the atmosphere and service--very friendly and accommodating. If you want great REAL Mexican food, this is the place for you.

2.description: I Called around 8 30 pm on a Wednesday night because yelp says this business delivers. The lady who answered presented herself "for here or to go." When I asked for delivery she totally changed her tone and said they didnt deliver..so upset.

9.description: The food was amazing! Didn't have to wait for a table and the server was very polite. Strongly recommend.

10.description: One of the most authentic Mexican restaurant I have ever been to in Chicago area...hands down...best there is.We had a great afternoon here and I would highly recommended

4.description: I tried the steak nachos and tacos the tacos were real good homemade tortillas which I really liked I will for sure try this place again.

6.description: I've been here about 5 to 6 times I'd say and each time is pretty bad from the service from the waitresses to the food and pick-up. Usually we'd be poorly attended. Seems like they pay less attention if you're not a regular. Food was served very slow. Took about half an hour to get two simple tacos so they were very cold. The waitress that we got on one night was very rude and honestly made us never come back. Oh, and pick up? More like dine-in since they never wrote down my order.

11.description: This restaurant has very AUTHENTIC Mexican feel of a restaurant , i have been there 3 times in the last month, and loved everything! the have the cheapest and most delicious mexican breakfasts!!   for like $6  you have choice of eggs! (not even at mickie D's you get something like that) with handmade corn tortillas (although they also have flour tortillas if you like your breakfast more Tex-Mex style) I highly recommend this place for steaks ( and fish too!) everything is delicious. And if you are the kind of person who likes to be entertained while you dine, theres DJ, live music and dancing on weekends (they also have a jukebox) This place is awesome, this is the place I go for my Mexican food fix ;)

5.description: Great service. Great food. Enchiladas are the best! I just wish they would serve a little bit more rice. Karaoke night on Friday and Sundays! I love it here! I come often.

7.description: A place that doesn't get too much press but is well worth it. After new management took over, the food and service got way better. Everything I've tried her is to die for and their prices are reasonable.  There's a Cocula's not too far from this restaurant and their savor doesn't even compare to Cinco Estrellas.  They also serve alcohol for those who are interested. Seriously, if you feel like venturing out to the south side and trying some delicious Mexican food, go there!!!

8.description: One of my favorite Mexican restaurants in the south side of Chicago. From the hand made tortillas to their fresh waters everything here is great. They sell beer and its a big restaurant which is great cause you usually never have to wait. Not a lot of people know about it but you won't regret trying it. 5 stars!

0.description: This is my first time here and let me tell you the food was good.  I had Carne a la Tampiqueña and the meat was very tender and juicy. They have home made tortillas.
Great chicken at great price. Ordered chicken for catering for 50 people under $250 got quality and quantity. Guacamole is excellent. They deliver which is a plus.

1.description: I have used Christina's Sweet Creations for many family celebrations.  They include my daughter's baptism, my best friends bridal shower, and even for gifts for my daughter's teachers. I have ALWAYS been EXTREMELY happy with what she has created and have recommended her to many of my other friends and family. I plan on using her for my daughter's first birthday. I can't wait to see what her extremely, creative and genius mind comes up with. Everything has always been on time, she does have great service and great prices and can create any type of design you explain or give to her. You should give her a try!!

2.description: Great service, great prices, the delivery was on time. The decoration on the cake was beautiful. The bread was a little dry but it might have been the type of cake i chose. Def. A must try!!

0.description: I have ordered from Christina multiple times and she never dissapoints. Her work is both beautiful and delicious. Her prices are great and delivery is always on time. I definitely would recommend you give her work a try.

3.description: Free food for....EVERYONE? Very Nice. God Bless you, Gamblers. Being in a pool league, I get to travel to different bars. I have been to my fare share of holes. This is a neighborhood bar fitted with a dart room, yes DART ROOM! The bar is pretty stardard but the service is outstanding. It gives me a homely feel to it. The man and woman behind the counter were friendly and inviting and constantly checking on the free food making sure everything gets rotated. The pool table was very well maintained and gave us players ample room to shoot. The have a giant dart room with maybe 6-7 dart boards for league also (i am guessing). This is an awesome neighborhood bar and great service and quality. Nothing too fancy but nice enough to not be a dive bar.

1.description: The neighborhood is not the best in the city but this is perhaps the best dart bar perhaps in the area. A local joint for the non immigrant community of Albany Park the place was decent enough although with its name perhaps four or more poker machines would of been appropriate

2.description: Ahhh... Good ole gamblers...

9.description: I started playing darts there early 2001 and have been a true regular ever since.  Jackie has to be the most conscientious bar owner in the city!  She has the most dart teams coming out of her bar than any other dart bar in the city, too.  Ray, Greg, Donna, and Dorothy are also the great bartenders.  She has her annual BitchFest in February that gathers all her ladies for a Sunday afternoon of fun/frolic/bitchiness (in the best way).

10.description: Gambler's is a PERFECT neighborhood bar.  Same faces for years which makes it so special.  Formerly, MONGO's and prior to that Blue Adriatic.  Wonderful bar staff (especially Ray). I only go a few times a year to reunion with old friends and family and I am treated as if I were there on a daily basis.  Tip well, they deserve it.

4.description: Cheap drinks, good juke box, friendly staff.  Thanks for the good times!

6.description: Staff is GRRRRRRRRRRRRRRReat!  Hey DJ...play that funky music white boy!  Cheap drinks and a pool table...can't go wrong

12.description: This is a very down to earth pub where the owner will personally serve you and make you feel welcome. They have a seperate room where they have live music once a month or so. The last time I went they didn't have many different things to eat, so you can go to one of the restaurants that are nearby if you like.

5.description: Gamblers is an Albany Park institution, long established as one of the finest dart bars in the city, the tradition continues on as flocks of darters will come far and wide to fling sharp pointy darts at their impressive row of darts again and again. One of the greatest things of being a Yelper and being in a dart league is that every other week I get to try out a usually new dart bar and get the opportunity to get into the nitty gritty and experience the best of what dives have to offer. Playing here on Tuesday night, Gamblers furnished us with a soup and salad buffet with plenty of chips and dessert. Who knew!? Random dive bars hook it up with the eats, joe!Having such a good time with their congenial and well-mannered team, me and my fellow teammates returned to Gamblers on a Saturday night to sharpen our teeth on the boards and to hang out. My friend ran into his co-worker who is in one of the higher level leagues and I saw plenty of Windy City Darters board members hanging out and shooting out.The Windy City Darters were having an official Nickel level qualifier and people were playing for some big money. Afterwards, they opened up a blind draw tournament and plenty of people played. I am always impressed with bars that still got the muscle to have Saturday night dart tournaments because it shows the robustness of the sport. At Gamblers there is no shortage of friendly northwestsiders and the Juke rarely stops playing.Over 40 dart trophies line their walls and people were playing all night. As we kept shooting until closing time, we were given free shots for keeping up the shooting. Seeing as how Gamblers is six blocks from my house , I can get myself used to playing marathon dart sessions with some of the best players in the city.

13.description: A place that caters to darts and is a great place for beginners and experts alike.  Plenty of dart boards (non-electronic) to choose from, and even during league nights, there are places to play.  While the place might seem creepy upon first entering, it isn't what it seems.   One might see a pathetic regular or two, sitting at the bar, watching the tv, but that isn't frequent.  Despite its relatively stark edifice, it's a great place with fun people - everyone laughs and hangs with their groups.  Pool costs a buck I think, and they have (I think) 6 steel-tip dart boards in the fantastic back room.  There's Golden Tee, an ATM, and a Millenium touch machine.  The bartenders are great, and Jackie, the owner, is the sweetest.

11.description: It's a hole in the wall, dive, neighborhood bar.  Once you've been there a few times, it's like you're family.  The bartenders are a trip and the owner is the sweetest... but don't you dare cross her!  If you're looking for a little bar that offers good music on the juke box, darts and regulars to chat with... I'd recommend gamblers!

8.description: This was a good find.  A friend and I stumbled upon Gamblers when we were an hour early for a dinner party.  The sign says "thirsty" under the name.  We were greeted with a warm welcome and the regulars were quite nice.  The prices were great too...$6.75 for a Makers rocks and Schitz...not too shabby.  If you ever find yourself in Albany park or looking to get drink before the strip club, Gamblers is the place to be.

0.description: Gamblers is the perfect place to grab a beer, watch the Blackhawks, Bears, Cubs, play pool or darts with friends and enjoy the evening. They have plenty or TVs, a couple pool tables and a whole room dedicated to darts. On Sundays they usually have free food. The bartenders are wonderful and the owner is awesome and the clientele is friendly.

7.description: Oh, dive bars, how I love thee!  Gamblers, you are about to become part of my regular haunts despite that I live nowhere near you.  I have not played darts in 10+ years, and I was never good at it.  I had so much fun here.  Even though my friends are really good at darts and so are the regulars, I felt oh so comfortable here.  Local bar, cheap, crappy beer by the pitcher, Kettle One, friendly staff and regulars who embrace newbies...perfect night.

3.description: Never really had a bad experience, if i call in my order is either ready or its almost ready. Good food and i really dont have nothing bad to say. When i wanna get away from jerk chicken i hit this spot.

1.description: I swear I only come here cause the BF likes their food. Don't get me wrong. It's good. But the customer service sucks. Every cashier I ever experienced here has the swankiest attitude and acts like my ordering food here somehow inconvenience them. Not to mention the local weed man and bootleg movies stay posted at all times. That might be a good thing if that's what you're into.

2.description: A buddy and I would've given I57 a higher ranking, but the young lady who took our order had a very funky attitude - for no apparent reason.  I told her that this was our first time eating at I57!  Sauce is Boss.  All I wanted was a sample of their three different barbecue sauces, but she told us "we don have anythin to give out fo you to sample are sauces in." Pssssss...she should not be your front line if she can't service customers with a smile.  Good food plus bad customer service do not necessarily bring customers back.  Attention Owner/Manager.......please fix this problem because your reputation and brand should be and is important.  There are hundreds of rib joints shacks throughout the greater Chicagoland.  Your customers deserve better service when they are spending their hard earned money.  I ordered the lunch portion mini rib tips for about 6 or 7 dollars and it came with 5 rib tips, 15 french fries, 2 slices of cheap white bread, cole slaw and a diabetic red "Vess" pop.  I will admit that the meat was actually cooked well and it was tender too....so they know how to Q.  I just wished that I had a chance to try their other types of barbecue sauces.I will give I57 another chance, but it will not be at the one on Western.

5.description: Soul food? Yes, please! A bunch of us at the office decided to order carry-out one day and we opted for I-57 Rib House. Barbecue rib tips, sausage links, chicken wings, fried gizzards, fried catfish.....the list goes on. You know the deal.I had the lunch special with fried catfish nuggets, French fries, bread, hushpuppies, and pop. All for just $6! The food arrived lukewarm so I had to toss it in the microwave for a minute. Surprisingly, the four chunks of catfish remained intact and crispy! Couldn't complain much! The bed of fries, on the other hand, under performed. It was soft and bland. Fortunately, my order also came with salt. But where was the pepper?! The bread was simply two slices of whites placed on top like a hat. Nothing to bring home about.Note: Their hot sauce isn't weak. Beware!

6.description: This place is not as clean as the one on 115th! Food is not that fresh. Customer service is skills are lacking. They are very rude and obnoxious! They handle call ins very unprofessional!! I had guests here from out of state who placed an order over the phone and the girl who took the call was very rude and disrespectful. My thing is If you don't like your job then find a new one.  Western will not be getting any money from me any more!

7.description: I love this spot. A few of the locations have closed down and I am glad that this one survived.  Call your order in to cut down on the wait time. All fried orders do take awhile as the cook them to order, but worth the wait. I took tip / chicken combo in to work and it was funny to see the people come around the corner asking what I had that smelled so good, and yes I shared :). It's a CASH only place.

0.description: Yeah I tried Alices, but not as good as I57. Food has always been the best around, yes they are slow, but worth the wait.One bad experience doesn't count for everything. If you haven't tried this place yet, I suggest you go for it! The one on 97th and Halsted may be even better

4.description: I love i57 ribhouse. I normally get the wing and tip combo with hot sauce. Its one of the best rib tip restaurants in the city.

3.description: Best pizza ever!!!! great crust, inexpensive, delicious sauce. I come here very often and have yet to be disappointed.I love this pizza!!!!

1.description: I don't understand how anyone gave this place 5 stars worst pizza ever ....I rather be hungry then eat here ever again ... The sausage taste horrible the mushroom were black!!! Burnt cause they cheaped us on the sauce... The sauce had no flavor I feel like they just opened a can of tomato paste and poured a few tablespoons...do not order pizza from here unless u like heartburn and a shitty aftertaste... Not even worth the one star I had to give them

2.description: The last time I got an Onesti's Pizza was in the early 70's. I want some o' dat soooooooooooooooo bad!!!!!!!!!! I been on the West Coast so access is near impossible. Next time I'm in ChicagoLand I WILL GET A PIZZA!!!!!!! AT ONESTI'S!!!!! I just found out that they're still there!!!! YAY!!!!!!!!

0.description: Best pizza ever!!!!
OK. Tonie the food was fresh cooked just right not over seasoned. Thanks to the Cook we are very happy. Now all they need is a working phone!!
Very impressed by the professionalism, timeliness and service!Great customer service and would definitely reorder and recommend!

1.description: If I could I would give this place no stars. You would think by serving so many ice cream cones they would know how to place a scoop of ice cream on a cone without breaking it and then giving it to you thinking you would be okay with it. The place is smelly too. Last time I will be going there.

2.description: Located at a corner in which businesses where doomed for failure since it's home to about it's 4th business in 3 years, this place really is everything that all the others weren't.  Awesome service, below average prices, and very tasteful products! Hope to have it in the neighborhood for a while!

0.description: I like this place my daughter love the ice-cream and it is just only $1.25 a scoop which is not bad at all, most places are a bit more.The people working here are very nice and friendly... Like the other yelper said it's like the 4th business here in 3 years hope this stays in my opinion is the best one..

3.description: I can't lie .... writing this review right now makes me want to go get a couple cheeseburgers. I love White Castles but the service, of course, varies from location to location. This one is pretty decent in terms of service and quality. I haven't had any bad experiences with the staff although they can seem a bit moody when taking your order in the drive-thru but for some reason by the time you get up to the window to get your food they seem to be real polite and hospitable lol. I never go in so i don't know what the place is like on the inside but this the White Castle that i frequent the most.

1.description: For what it is: A WHITE CASTLE. Its okay. Back in the day at my Bucktown home on the North Side we use to go to White Castle on Milwaukee and Armitage and this one reminded me of that. I go through the Drive Thru and it is really fast. They get your order and even are pleasant about it. I like when an employee smiles and says "Have a wonderful day" even if the day is gloomy and dank, this helps. They are just White Castle but I do go back all the time, it does help when you get treated well. PS: If you live in the neighborhood, USE THE COUPONS that they give you in the mail and get free items.

2.description: Although I'm usually not in this area, I found myself here while en route home after a funeral. Absolutely starving I decided to drive through  for a slider to hold me over until I got home for dinner.  I didn't expect much from the food, it's a white castle slider, they pretty much are the same everywhere.What was DIFFERENT about this white castle is that the woman working drive-thru was extremely courteous. My order was wrong even though it appeared correct on the drive-thru screen, but I didn't even call back to complain because the drive-thru personnel was so nice I wouldn't dare say anything that may get her in trouble. She had a smile in her voice and at the window.  Great job!

0.description: I went last week for some fries on my way to a work meeting and its right off the 49 Western bus stop. Its decent not a lot of hoodrats hanging out there orders taken quickly. It's clean but they need to keep the floors mopped since people spill a lot of stuff on the floors causing it to get sticky frequently. Good service overall.

3.description: Wow!  I finally ventured past Gurifuna Flava to check out Ray's Island Grill and I am soooo glad I did!!  Although this is a take out only spot, you have to take food this good home so that you can black out into your food coma after eating.  I ordered the Jerk Catfish with a sample of Jerk Wings to sample.  The fish and chicken was so well seasoned [not salty at all] I'm sure that they marinated it overnight.  With the dinner came rice and peas [excellent and tender, not dry like they've been on a steam table all day], streamed cabbage, and sweet plantain.  Absolutely fabulous!!  I am a customer for life!  Not only is this place close to my home, they are open 7 days a week AND they have Jerk Turkey Wings!!!!  Those who don't know better check this place out!  I will post pictures of their menu soon.

1.description: I saw this spot a few times before so I decided to give it a try today.  They need some assistance with the decor; it's dated, not much $$ spent.  The order taker had a thick accent, not the friendliest, but not rude.  The music station was great.  They offer daily specials unlike some of their competitors.  I looked online for menu but no luck.  It only took 15 mins for my jerk chicken dinner.  I carried it home.  The chicken wasn't that spicy which is good & bad, not all of us can handle some of those jerk spices.  The rice was ok, now that needed more umph.  The cabbage was dry, I'm not impressed.  The single plantain was cooked well done, not juicy like the other spots I visit.  The jerk sauce was ok, not too spicy, but decent.   This spot is one of those u go to when u don't feel like traveling to your usual spot.

2.description: Good food! Good music! Good prices! The guy on the truck is always friendly...just wish the young lady at the location was just as nice. Try the jerk tacos...You won't be disappointed!

0.description: I've passed by Ray's Island Grill a few times and finally decided to stop in and give them a try. I ordered the jerk catfish lunch. I'm not sure what it is lately with these cuts on the catfish steaks, but they're thin compared to what I'm accustomed to at Ja Grill, Jerk Villa and when Garifuna Flava used to carry catfish on there menu. Regardless, it comes with three pieces, red beans & rice, cabbages and plantains for $8.00. The one thing I didn't particularly care for was the cabbage because it lacked flavor, but everything else was exceptional. It was well worth the price and I'm glad I decided to visit. I'll definitely be dropping in more often and recommend them to others.

4.description: So glad I found this spot!! I've been searching for a long time for jerk chicken in my neighborhood without having to travel to the other side of town.  The food was good, the portions were large, and I have enough to take to lunch tomorrow.  The prices were normal for jerk restaurants, so no biggie.  I had a chicken dinner with rice and beans, and candied yams.  The yams were a little under cooked, but I still ate it! I'll be back!!

1.description: Martin is amazing! my 4yr old will not let anyone else cut his hair. he is also the only one that cuts it the way i like it.

0.description: Martin is the best....haven't let anyone else do my hair for the last 9 yrs!!

3.description: The ONLY thing wrong with this place is that they don't accept credit/debit cards. (But considering the neighborhood, that MIGHT be a good thing!)The waitstaff has always been very friendly and receptive. I love the fact that you do NOT have to be fluent in Spanish in order to order your food (and know what the heck you are eating!). The chips are great, the beans & rice are great...the enchiladas are to die for!! I'm also a vegetarian, and I've never had an issue ordering food "sin carne" (without meat). The waitstaff are bilingual (English and Spanish) and have no problems taking "special" orders. The "ambience" of the place is nothing special....there are booths, and they usually have Telemundo playing on the tv and there is a huge jukebox (that does work, yay!) and a few video games towards the back. If you are familiar with the neighborhood, the usual teenage crowd that comes in and out of there won't bother you. If you're not familiar with the 63rd street residents, then don't come alone. I've eaten at this restaurant late at night (after 8pm) with only my 5 year old daughter in tow, but then again, I know how to handle myself. If you want quick, fast and delicious Mexican food, this IS the place to go!

1.description: Been coming here for 30 years. This is the onlyplace to end an evening out in Chicago! Bad hood, great burritos!

2.description: Yea maybe not. It was around 3 in the morning and we were driving back from a bar . My friend was hungry( he is always hungry, lol) and this was the only place that was open so we decided to check it out. He ordered pork in red sauce and I ordered a steak burrito and a chorizo taco. I tasted his food and it was bland. the sauce was watery and the meat wasn't the best. beans and rice just bland. When it comes to my food, the burrito was just not that bad but not good either. The taco, I took a bite and put it down wishing I had never taken that bite, it was awful. My friend was a little drunk but I wasn't. maybe I need to get really drunk and give them another try. Yea not gonna happen lol. The service is just there. They are not rude, but they are not friendly. I guess it is understandable, midnight shift yea maybe not.

5.description: Ah, yes, I have spent many nights chowing on one of their steak burritos.  Talk about comfort food!   This all night burrito joint has some of the best mexican food coming out of a store front.  Beware late at night, however, as the crowd here can get a little rough, but if you can hold your own it's totally worth it!Be sure to try some of their horchata (or-CHA-ta)!!  It is heaven in a cup!  If you like rice pudding you'll love the horchata here!  For those of you who don't know what horchata is:  It's rice milk sweetened with sugar and flavored with cinnamon and almonds and is very delicious... can you tell that I like horchata?

6.description: UofC students know of this place.  Oh, they might not know the actual name (too busy learning about the Peloponnesian War), but they know it as "Burrito" - a great place to trek to when you're drunk.  And a trek it is.  You have to brave some pretty sketchy neighborhoods to get there, but it's totally worth it.  If you respect your burrito, you don't pierce it with utensils.  You simply rub it, love it, then scarf it down.  Oh, and if you're a football player, you eat 4 of them and don't ask about the contents.  Then, when you're middle-aged and sad, you drag your friends from the North Side to show them how geeks eat burritos.  I love this place!I just thought of the best part of El Gallo, there are no annoying LPTs holding up the line - talking on their cells.  They can't venture this far south - their BMWs would get stolen in a heartbeat.Tip:  If you're a vegetarian, learn how to order in Spanish or you'll find yourself on the receiving end of an all steak burrito.

7.description: Yeah the tarcos here are groot.  I usually go with my bardies to knouwnch on some and my favorite dishel that they harve is the carsardillos with choronzo.  Yarmy!

8.description: great taco's here (you can even buy a pack of cigs), there meat is nice and crispy, always fresh, and seasoned perfect. I've been coming here since the neighborhood was actually a nice place to live in. i still come here since i dont live to far. yes the neighborhood isnt great, but isnt  to bad if you come during the morning or early afternoon hours.

0.description: Best in town since I was a teen.  I'm now 52.

4.description: This place is legend.  I went over 300 times in college.  I was told by a guy that had grown up in the neighborhood that during the late 70's it was involved in a coke smuggling ring, taken over by the gov't and turned back into private bus. in the late 80's I reco getting the casadilla especial with steak and cilantro.  It comes with pablano, chiu. cheese, and onions.  I also reco getting the crema, which is whipped sour cream.  It's good on everything.  Cash only, don't go alone-

0.description: After trying many of their other bread, I must say that this is the best Mexican bread I have found so far in Chicago. They have these extremely delicious croissants that also have the sugary stuff found on conchas. All-in-all, you can't go wrong with any of the bread here, just make sure to get there early before they sell out of their best stuff.

1.description: I ordered a caramel iced coffee and they put absolutely no caramel and to top it off no whip cream! I'm sooo disappointed in dunkin because of this experience! And I tried to go back and ask them if they can add caramel and extra whopped cream and they asked for 25 cents! Like are you kidding me!!? You guys suck

2.description: Average Dunkin. Cool thing about this place is they have Baskin Robins and you can slice 2 birds with 1 samurai sword.

0.description: These girls know how to make their coffee

3.description: This Burger King has no concept of what is fast food. It's always Russian Roulette when I go in. Either there out if something or it takes 15-20 minutes to get your order. Wanted a coffee this morning and the girl didn't even acknowledge me. Just stood their taking orders at the drive through. Walked out. Horrible. They sometimes act like their doing you a favor. By the way, how do you run out of soda? Really?!

1.description: One of the top two worst Burger Kings i've been to. Their ability to mess up an order must be a superpower of theirs.Everything from order-taking skills to the whole "excuse me... can you please back up and then pull back forward" crap is ridiculous.One time i ordered a bacon, egg, and cheese croissant and ended up with value menu chicken sandwhich! I've been through plenty of drive-thru's and half a mile away only to realize that i didn't get what i ordered but this just baffled me. It was only a couple minutes after 9 am! What were they even doing making that kind of a sandwich that early?? I know you can get a Whopper early but a chicken sandwich from the value menu?? I was upset so i went back... The lady asked me if i wanted some french fries for the mixup lol. Yeah ... that's what i had taste for .... a bacon, egg, and cheese croissant and french fries lol.

2.description: I never had a problem here.always got what I expected and customer service was    acceptable.only complaint is that soda machine isn't kept up with properly(i.e. flat pop).

0.description: It's Burger king people. Please! They follow the rules, try to get their orders right and try very hard to keep the bathroom clean. Some people just come in to stay warm or order from the dollar menu to be able to hang out inside. I would not be that picky. When your starving and nothing else is open, this does not seem like such a bad place at all.

4.description: You think you come to this Burger King and think you can get it your way..... bullshit! Now, I'm not a unreasonable customer, or difficult to deal with, but I take concern when it comes to a place of business where I spend my money. You could atleast give me quality customer service, which would also include hot food....that's fresh and not reserved for me before you knew I was coming. A 40ish lady who works in the drive-thru, has an awfully smelly attiitude.....(And if you my dear, happen to read this, you know who you are....and I don't give a f**k , if I knew your name, I'd sure post it on here....w/ your mugshot. You just don't know how many times you gave me the wrong sandwiches with shit on them I didn't want and in exchange trade off and give your butt a sandwich with extra knuckles.) Later for you, chick!  Mmmm hmmm..... back to my friends @ Yelp. Please, for the sake of well deserved customer service, donot, I mean never, ever ever, eat there. Too many Burger Kings in Chgo. Choose another. Luv yall!

3.description: This is quite possibly worse Mcdonalds I've ever been to. I waited about 10 mins to get served on top of that ordered oatmeal and got grits. Then the lady kept telling me they were oatmeal..

1.description: I honestly tried rating lower than a one.  I have a deep hatred for this awful place.  It has literally brought me to tears out of frustration and anger on many an occasion. Don't order anything.  There's no point, because you're lucky if you even get it within this eon.I'm starting a support group for those who have been victimized by this McDonalds.  Know that you're not alone, and that there are others who have survived (barely).

2.description: Why is English the 2nd language here? Had to wait near 5 minutes for someone to make eye contact, numerous employees walked by after my order was placed on the counter.  All I would like is to get some catsup since it's not provided opposite the service side of the counter. I eat McDonalds two, maybe three times a year, I guess I was expecting too much. Twice a year, I guess I better find a better McDonalds next time.  None of these people deserve $15 an hour  ever  on their best day....  Better off closing the store

5.description: This particular location has improved in the last year. I used to get cold food no matter what time of day I went. At least now it's warm, the service is still slow though.

0.description: If you go through the drive thru it will take forever. The dinning area is really small but it is nicer than I expected. I would rather drive to tge McDonald's on Kedzie for faster service.

4.description: What a disaster. I waited 15 minutes in the drive thru and had to leave.  Worse drive thru experience I've ever had. It's apparently always this way. Everyone on Yelp and Google rates this place as "totally sucks." How does corporate let it stay in business?

3.description: I have been a long time customer of Classic Touch, it also helps when you know the owners. I have always had issues finding someone to do my hair without damaging it and I thought I had found that with the two sisters (Alicia and Araceli) - I was WRONG. I had been going to Classic Touch for over 8 years and the sisters always did a fabulous job whether it was the cut, the style or the color. Up until recently I have not been too happy with them. I only get my hair done with the two sisters and no one else and they both should have known this detail about me for being such a repeat customer. In November 2013 I decided to go ombre - Araceli had done such a fabulous job with it! When I returned in January for a touch up, her sister, Alicia, did the touch up. After having the dye washed out of my hair, the end result was my hair being dyed a platinum blonde. I dont know how often you see platinum blonde ombre on someone's head, but that is not how I wanted it or how I had it the first time - I had a more subtle blonde. I literally was about to cry because now the color was not what I wanted, but also my hair was fried to the max! Alicia decided in order to bring down the color she needed to put some toner... end result - my hair turned silver and purple. I wanted to cry. How was I going to go to school or to my internship with purple hair. Luckily after a few washes the ends became a darker blonde. However my ends were fried to the point where I could not leave my hair down - it looked like straw. Months later I was done with the ombre and decided to go back brunette. Araceli said that I should go darker than my natural hair to get the blonde out. I thought "Okay, she'll do it and it'll look fab like all the times before". NOPE. Because she was sooo busy with another client here ASSISTANT dyed my hair. LET ME REMIND YOU THAT I NEVER LET ANYONE ELSE BESIDES THE SISTERS DO MY CUT/STYLE/OR DYE. The assistant covered my hair in black ... missing spots along the way. I did not know that my hair was not fully covered until I got home and was told. My issue was with the sisters - they did not take care of my hair the way I thought they would. I gotten my hair straightened by Alicia and she never once thought to let me know that the assistant missed parts of my hair. How unprofessional is that? I have gone through the ringer with this salon and I will never go back. It was good while it lasted, however I thought I found my "go-to" place for hair. Now to start searching again. Hope this helps anyone out there.

1.description: My family has been a long time costumers here. I decided to get my eye brows waxed a while back And the new girl who waxed my brows waxed half of my brows off. Not OK!

2.description: Love love love love loveeee this place! You'll never find another place that washes, cuts, AND styles for $25! They do an outstanding job every time and the staff is so friendly and welcoming!

5.description: Great place for a hair style and cut

6.description: I used to be a long time customer. Nearly ten years to be exact, and each and every experience with this business was pleasant until recently. I went in to add copper low lights with Angelica and the end result was fire truck red and blonde highlights!!!! I'm not a color expert, but last time I checked there was a difference between the two shades. I also pointed to the color swatch I liked and provided a picture of their previous work. When I saw the end product, I didn't know how to react. While I stared at the hot mess, Angelica convinced me that after several washes the color would fade to what I wanted. Little did I know, I'd wash my hair and the red would bleed into the blonde making me look like Carrot Top's sister. This was beyond a hot mess! I called and let them know what the situation was and Araceli, the shop manager assured me she would fix it. I went in and again the same stylist took care of me. I asked her to get rid of the red, and so she began. Turns out she just toned it down. Again, not what I asked for. Notice any patterns? Anyways, third is sorta the charm because I was fed up and just wanted it all gone. She covered it with a half effort job because now I have random patches of red, and burgundy over my natural color. As if this wasn't enough, all through out this return visit, Angelica was passive- aggressive. Smiling at me but snickering on the side, and very hard on my head, pulling and tugging at my hair as she "fixed" it. After this experience, it is needless to say that I will not be returning. They have lost several customers since many of my relatives and friends were also clients. Its a true disappointment that there is no professionalism or real responsibility with their work or to their customers. Consumers, beware of the potential wrecks you're paying for at this place.

0.description: I have known the management of Classic Touch Hair Salon, it is a happy Salon where you can go in having a couple of bad hair days and you look and feel rejuvenated!  The salon's strength is they know their happy clients for years.  The owner manager and her staff are filled with wisdom and understanding.  I have travelled for business in the USA and internationally and their is no place like having friends to build you or create a new successful you!My mother has been a happy client for many years.

4.description: Have been going here for YEARS!  The ladies at the salon do a great job.  Great cut and color at affordable prices.They do such a wonderful job with up-dos for weddings and other special occasions.  I drive out 4 to 5 times a year and it is a good 3 if not 4 hour drive round trip...but well worth journey. I would 100% recommend their services :)

1.description: I've always bought my flowers from here. The service is wonderful and the people that work here are just amazing and friendly.

2.description: Lupita's florist was awesome. I contacted her after another local flower shop failed to deliver a birthday bouquet I had ordered early in the day for my sister. I was in Miami and my sister is in Chicago, down the  street from my sister. Within minutes she had secured payment and committed to delivery the order the same day...7pm was when I contacted her. Amazing!!! She saved me from a possible disasterous outcome. I will call her again for my mom's birthday flowers later this month. Thank you so much,  love, love, love them. Janet Cisneros

0.description: Lupita's Florist is amazing! We hired Lupita to provide all flowers for my wedding and they were absolutely breathtaking arrangements, boutonnieres, bouquets and everything! Her spirit is calm and relaxing and her execution is flawless. I recommend her without any hesitation! People are still talking about our flowers nearly six months later! Thank you Lupita and you entire team including your husband!

1.description: Absolutely delicious cakes! Try their chocolate mocha cake!

0.description: Luna's has the BEST tres leches cakes!  My family still makes me drive out there and get all the cakes for our parties.The prices are reasonable too!  We've been going there for years and the accept Dbt/Visa which is a plus ++++

1.description: Grandma gets it cracking in the joint always fresh and ummm ummm good

0.description: Healthful Soul Food!!! Candied Sweets, Greens with smoked turkey, Turkey meatloaf, Beef Short-Ribs, cornbread, mac 'n cheese. Wooden Spoon is a little spot on 70th and Western that pledges to make healthful affordable homemade food for the community while also respecting individual dietary restrictions. Essie is the Owner and she and her son Lloyd make their food fresh every day. Essie is a phenomenal cook! Her portions are generous and her prices are more than reasonable. She also caters for business lunches and our company has used her in the past with a great reaction from our staff with prompt and piping-hot delivery.  Her cookies and cakes rock! Breakfast is good, cheap and made-to-order with scrambles,  grits, turley patties, etc.

1.description: Food was great and service was even better.  Didn't think they would do special request but boy was i surprised.  I will be coming again and again.

0.description: Finger Food. First time here and I loved it . I'll be back for sure. Owner made our experience great. 100% authentic Mexican food.I recommend this to everyone . #IKNOWfood

1.description: Ordered online. It was fast and hot. Your norm Chinese delivery. Can't complain had huge portion and good flavor for the price.

0.description: The food was excellent. I had it delivered and the Crab Rangoon and egg rolls were hot and crisp.

1.description: Con: This WAS my primary produce market. At first, the prices were great and the quality was, too. However, as of recent, the quality has declined significantly. For instance, my last two tomato purchases had been red and firm on the outside, sour, green and slime on the inside. Same with the cucumbers - firm and green on the outside but squishy and watery when cut. Very disappointing! Pro: The meat is fairly priced. They offer marinated meats at the Butchers, as well.Con: Other products like dry goods and dairy are priced ~$2 above average. Pro: Excellent place to find eclectic seasonings for many typea of dishes.

9.description: Mayfair Market opened TODAY in the former Walgreen's (which itself had moved into a new building a block north quite awhile ago). It's a bit weird walking into a brand-new grocery with fully stocked shelves, perfectly displayed piles of fruits and vegetables, and immaculate floors thanks to its workers mopping the aisles non-stop (hey - it's NEW!). This grocery should give the nearby Fiesta Market some stiff competition (only a block away), with a variety of Mexican products. It's bigger than Fiesta, so I was combing the aisles and also found quite a few Indian and Mediterranean products too. I bought green beans, broccoli, ginger, grapes, along with interesting items like a bag of plantain chips, a 6-pack of mini dulce-de-leche cups, and a box of spicy frozen mini-samosas. A free parking lot is south of the store. I will definitely be back to shop here!

23.description: I am not impressed. I was so excited waiting for this place to open. I am a fresh fruit and veggies junkie. While the quality was comparable to other such markets in the area, the prices we about 20% higher on average. I realize the place just opened and they may be marking up now to re coop losses, but with so many other sh-options, I literally decided to take it elsewhere and left. I'll go back in late spring and see it things have come down a bit. I was bummed.Update:7-31-09Way better experience as of late.  Great meat section, fresh produce.  I like-y!

25.description: Mayfair Market opened TODAY in the former Walgreen's (which itself had moved into a new building a block north quite awhile ago). It's a bit weird walking into a brand-new grocery with fully stocked shelves, perfectly displayed piles of fruits and vegetables, and immaculate floors thanks to its workers mopping the aisles non-stop (hey - it's NEW!). This grocery should give the nearby Fiesta Market some stiff competition (only a block away), with a variety of Mexican products. It's bigger than Fiesta, so I was combing the aisles and also found quite a few Indian and Mediterranean products too. I bought green beans, broccoli, ginger, grapes, along with interesting items like a bag of plantain chips, a 6-pack of mini dulce-de-leche cups, and a box of spicy frozen mini-samosas. A free parking lot is south of the store. I will definitely be back to shop here!

12.description: They're grocery items aren't the best and pretty average, but their produce and its variety is amazing.  They also have a wide range of tortillas that are brought in fresh usually daily.  I am moving back to the suburbs and I am going to miss this store so much.  I haven't found anything like it in the NW suburbs yet.

21.description: wow this place is clean! its lovely to have a local market with a produce section that doesn't look like its been ravaged by savages (see tony's on elston). the meat counter smells like.... wait for it... NOTHING! i point this out because, once again, tony's on elston has a meat counter that smells like a combination of rot and bleach. the prices are low and the produce i've gotten has been quite good so far.the selection of shelf stable items is not extensive but you've pretty much got all your staples. they also have some interesting ethnic foods, some pre-packaged indian/middle eastern stuffs and of course your standard mexican fare.hopefully mayfair keeps up with the cleanliness and organization of their market; its appreciated.

16.description: I am not impressed. I was so excited waiting for this place to open. I am a fresh fruit and veggies junkie. While the quality was comparable to other such markets in the area, the prices we about 20% higher on average. I realize the place just opened and they may be marking up now to re coop losses, but with so many other sh-options, I literally decided to take it elsewhere and left. I'll go back in late spring and see it things have come down a bit. I was bummed.Update:7-31-09Way better experience as of late.  Great meat section, fresh produce.  I like-y!

17.description: This cute little grocery store is right down the street from my house.  Its nice to go there when I want some inexpensive produce or something and I don't want to trek all the way up to the Jewel.  The produce is very affordable and really fresh.The store does cater to Mexican tastes though, so there are some things in there that I as a Midwestern gal originally from Indiana didn't quite understand.  It doesn't have everything, but if I need to pick something up for dinner, its an easy 5 minute walk and very convenient.  I can't beat that!

10.description: Great produce market!  The produce is always fresh and inexpensive.  You never see a wrinkled pepper or a bruised tomato at Mayfair, unlike some of the other nearby produce marts.Yes, the pre-packaged foods are pricey and limited, but produce and meats are what you should be coming to Mayfair for.  Go to Jewel for your Frosted Mini-Wheats.I got the most amazing chorizo here once for next to nothing.  Mmmm...chorizo...

5.description: Very clean store, decent prices and I love the fact you can pick your own carnitas for 3.99lb

11.description: Strange vibe. Produce is great but the product is expensive compared to other markets. Im always shocked to see how far the cashierwill go to completely ignore every nice thing I say. Clean, well stocked but I might just have to avoid this place in leiu of other, more affordable markets.

22.description: I appreciate having a new grocery store within walking distance of my home.  Not only for the convenience factor, but for the array of produce (and more) that's unique to a neighborhood like this.The first thing you notice is how clean, organized, and well-stocked everything is.  Can I get an Amen on that?!  The produce section has all my favorites - plantains, 2 kinds of avocados, fresh okra, upo, bitter melon, yuca, and more than I can remember right now.  Plus they have a few items that I haven't tried yet - tindora and fresh curry leaves to name a few.  Heads of garlic and limes were on sale for 10 cents each.  What's not to love?I headed over to the butcher section and noticed all kinds of cuts that I love to cook with, like oxtail and shanks.  The deli section has paneer, feta, Mexican cheeses, and various deli meats.  And the seafood section had langoustines, which I was very tempted to buy.  But I'll save that for another time.The shelves were stocked with goodies from India, the Middle East, Peru, Mexico, and Europe.  We're talking about spices, jams, pickled vegetables, pate, a large variety of dried legumes, candies (they sell my favorite - La Cubanita's dulce de leche fudge), marinades, pita from Al Khayyam Bakery, European bread from Val's Bakery, etc.  The freezer section has frozen Indian vegetables, Malaysian paratha, empanada wrappers, sofrito, arepas, samosas, Peruvian corn, and more.Basically, if you like to cook with these ingredients, this store is for you.  This isn't a "one stop shopping" place, but there are other stores nearby where you can purchase everything else.  Happy cooking.-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------7/23:  I made tilapia ceviche and found all the ingredients here.  They carry Rocoto pepper paste, which is a Peruvian pepper used in traditional ceviche.  Score!  I also purchased garlic plantain chips, which were perfect with the ceviche.On a side note for vegetarians in the neighborhood, they do carry TVP (textured vegetable protein).  They have "beef" and "chicken" strips and crumbles, and "chorizo" crumbles.
