0.description: I'm glad that Mayfair Market was salvaged by the new ownership who took over approximately one (1) month ago.  The fresh produce was fully-stocked; the categories of meat in the meat department was neatly presented; the seafood department wasn't so shabby, either.  The entire venue was clean and easy to navigate.  Although I don't consider Mayfair Market was a "one-stop" place for grocery shopping, the prices for produce, for the most part, are competitive.  We got 2 and 1/4 lb worth of apples, two (2) cucumbers, one (1) bundle of Mexican green onions, one (1) head of iceberg lettuce, one (1) bag of red grapes, one (1) tray of skirt steak, two (2) pieces of Mexican sweet bread, one (1) bag of carrots, and two (2) lb worth of bananas for under  $14!!  I don't think that's bad at all.  I also like the itemized monitor at checkout.  The cashier accidentally double-charged the skirt steak, but since it was itemized with a large font, this mistake was quickly identified and corrected immediately.  I'm happy that Mayfair Market has made a comeback.P.S. They do have a private parking lot for your convenience.

20.description: Incredibly affordable produce and deli meats. I purchased two HUGE bags of food for under $20 - something I could never achieve at the Jewel. Definitely not a place to get everything you need (no yogurt, dry goods are scant) but I am only buying my meat, cheese, and produce here from now on. Thank you, Mayfair!!

19.description: This place has the best prices on fruits and veggies in the area. I always go to this store to buy them. They make fresh pico de gallo and guacamole that I love - I highly recommend trying both of them!! I also really like the premade beef or chicken fajita mix at the deli counter - just cook and serve (so easy)! The one thing I wouldn't recommend buying there is name brand products. They tend to be a bit more expensive (convenience store type pricing).

2.description: I wouldn't even give them one star if that was an option... Humiliating experience at this place. Their cashier didn't even bother double bagging our heavy items with their flimsy bags. She was doing it all in a hurry (probably since she was going home soon)and put all our heavy stuff in one bag so of course it broke! We come back in, asking if we can get the items replaced and after the employee stopped to finish gossiping with some costumer then she got back to us, and refused because "it didn't happen in their property" They had a store policy sign displaying "no exchanges or refunds without a receipt", we had our receipt(and the transaction had happened like seconds beforehand) so I guess that sign is just there for show. The manager/owner went to the lowest of low by accusing my boyfriend of purposely dropping the stuff and that's why they wouldn't refund. So yeah if you are looking for good costumer service, fluent  English speaking staff that won't twist your words, and to get treated like a decent human being overall then this is not the place to go! Hopefully they don't treat everyone like that as I don't imagine it being any good for business. We basically paid for something we didn't even get. This business runs on stealing from their costumers...

18.description: Not a one stop shop, but very high quality produce and cheap prices. Wish they took Amex though.

13.description: A somewhat nearby alternative to Harvestime Foods! It's conveniently located at the intersection of Lawrence and Pulaski, where there are two major bus routes. In fact, there's a bus stop right in front of the store. There is a Walgreens, Chase, and whatnot a block or two away for "one-stop" errands.The volume of produce is great. It's not like freakin' Jewel in which there are 4 ugly and old zucchinis left. Mayfair is well-stocked and organized. The produce prices are very reasonable. I can't remember exact prices, but it was like 49¢ for a pound of onions and Idaho potatoes, less than 70¢ for an avocado, and whatnot.Although, the store looks much larger from the outside, it is actually not that big. Just like at Harvestime and other ethnic grocery stores, the pre-packaged and dry goods are a little pricier than big name stores. I shop at Aldi for such things.I dig it.

4.description: Ehhhhh, here's the thing:They used to keep this place well-stocked.  I don't mean like you can find "mainstream" products like you could find at jewel, but you could certainly find any "hispanic" food item you could ever possibly need.  The last four times I've come here though, it's like they've neglected to restock on anything except the produce.  There have been multiple times now where I've had to leave this store only to go to the grocery store on Lawrence and Drake just to get a common item.  Also it seems that as of late, they've risen a lot of their prices.  Milk is $1.50 - $2.00 more expensive here than just about any other grocery store.  As far as the produce goes, they have a good selection, and good quality.  The store is clean.  I just wish they didn't raise their prices, and they kept the store fully stocked.  I shouldn't have to go to a different fruteria to get enchilada sauce, y'know?I guess if I were to assess my mood after leaving this place most recently, I'd label the mood as "mad."  I was a little mad.

24.description: Finally a great neighborhood supermarket in Mayfair! Produce and meat/deli are the highlights. Quality and variety of these departments are outstanding.  I spoke to the manager and this is his 6th store in the Chicagoland area.  He explained that he wanted to cater to the variety of people we have in the neighborhood (Korean, Polish, Hispanic, Middle Eastern, etc.) therefore their is a great variety of foods in the store.  Opening day was Feb 18, 2009.

6.description: Terrible, terrible, terrible. That's the only way I can describe this store. They continue to display the Mexican flag upside down, even after I brought it to the managers attention. Terrible, insulting and disrespectfull. For shame.  22 days and counting.

15.description: I appreciate having a new grocery store within walking distance of my home.  Not only for the convenience factor, but for the array of produce (and more) that's unique to a neighborhood like this.The first thing you notice is how clean, organized, and well-stocked everything is.  Can I get an Amen on that?!  The produce section has all my favorites - plantains, 2 kinds of avocados, fresh okra, upo, bitter melon, yuca, and more than I can remember right now.  Plus they have a few items that I haven't tried yet - tindora and fresh curry leaves to name a few.  Heads of garlic and limes were on sale for 10 cents each.  What's not to love?I headed over to the butcher section and noticed all kinds of cuts that I love to cook with, like oxtail and shanks.  The deli section has paneer, feta, Mexican cheeses, and various deli meats.  And the seafood section had langoustines, which I was very tempted to buy.  But I'll save that for another time.The shelves were stocked with goodies from India, the Middle East, Peru, Mexico, and Europe.  We're talking about spices, jams, pickled vegetables, pate, a large variety of dried legumes, candies (they sell my favorite - La Cubanita's dulce de leche fudge), marinades, pita from Al Khayyam Bakery, European bread from Val's Bakery, etc.  The freezer section has frozen Indian vegetables, Malaysian paratha, empanada wrappers, sofrito, arepas, samosas, Peruvian corn, and more.Basically, if you like to cook with these ingredients, this store is for you.  This isn't a "one stop shopping" place, but there are other stores nearby where you can purchase everything else.  Happy cooking.-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------7/23:  I made tilapia ceviche and found all the ingredients here.  They carry Rocoto pepper paste, which is a Peruvian pepper used in traditional ceviche.  Score!  I also purchased garlic plantain chips, which were perfect with the ceviche.On a side note for vegetarians in the neighborhood, they do carry TVP (textured vegetable protein).  They have "beef" and "chicken" strips and crumbles, and "chorizo" crumbles.

7.description: I find myself shopping here less often.  The main reason is that they are lax regarding pulling products according to the expired date.  I've accidentally purchased bread here that was moldy.  Since then I've been paying closer attention and have found other items with expired dates for sale.  The other reason I've stopped coming here is that I can't find basic products like beans! Their shelves have become bare in areas.  I understand that it's a grocery catering to the neighborhood demographics but take a walk down their bean aisle.  I've stopped in three times in the last 3 weeks and could not find a single can of chick peas.  A display case that used to hold Mexican Coke was completely empty on my last visit.  I've asked about stocking a few products here and there, but I've never seen them carried.  The physical condition of the store has deteriorated as well.  The dirty floors and broken glass make you think twice about buying their products.Produce is okay for the most part.  Their meat counter seems to do a lot of business and I occasionally buy chicken breasts there.  Their guacamole is excellent and recommended.A few years ago, they sold deli meats by Dietz & Watson but it's now Sara Lee and the like.  I used to be able to do most of my shopping here since it was only a few blocks away but now I only stop in for a few items on occasion.

8.description: (Mostly) Good produce at a good price.  There were some berries on super sale and I was all excited, until I saw that over half of each package was moldy :(  other then that, they had a pretty good selection and the prices for the produce was great.  I took a walk around the rest of the store, prices seemed to be good and they had a pretty good variety of products.  Probably wouldn't go out of my way to come back, but if I was near by again and needed some produce, would definitely stop in.

3.description: UNDER NEW OWNERSHIP!!!!Dennis who owned Fiesta Fruit Market for years.. Later opening and running Mayfair Market from 2009-2011..   Has come back and taken over the store!! Motivated as always to provide the quality service the neighborhood remembers and deserves!!           Officially re-opening it's doors....        Wednesday SEPTEMBER 10th 2014

14.description: AWESOME produce selection!  Everything is always stocked and fresh and the prices are hard to beat.  They also have a very good butcher/deli section.  While their shelves aren't stocked with your usual big box grocery store products, they do have tons of great ethnic finds-Indian, Mexican, European, Middle Eastern, Chinese/Korean, etc.  Not really a one stop shop for me, but definitely worth the extra trip.

3.description: I've only tried their tacos and burritos, both are very good. I like the fact that they pick a taco of the day and make it a special. There's always an available table. The place is always super clean, the staff is friendly and efficient. Food comes out fast!

1.description: First time trying this place and I can say it's was pretty good. Their fresh salsa was really good. I tried the taco which were pretty big tacos with double tortilla I gave it 2 thumbs up, tried the sope and that was a good one and also big and last but not least a cheese and salsa gordita.

2.description: I like their chicken a lot, the beans are not that good, the rice is good, I feel indifferent about the steak. Fast and good service, lovely place . the only thing I hate is that it's cash only :( .

0.description: I recently rediscovered this place.I had been here a couple of years ago when they first opened. I don't  why I stopped coming here.In my recent visits I have had many different kind of tacos. Cecina, pastor and steak. all of them are very good, big tacos so don't go crazy ordering many thinking they are small. Usual drink menu of a taqueria.The place is really clean. set up kinda like a updated diner. Bar and a few tables. They close at 9 so it is good for lunch and early dinner. The service is sporadically there. Lol sometimes you see them sometime you don't.  It doesn't bother me though.This is a good place if you are in the neighborhood, but I wouldn't make a trip from Kashaki, WI to come here. Keep an eye for the daily special. It is a good deal for something you would've gotten anyway.TLH good place P.S. If you are wondering about Kashaki, WI. It is a little town in WI where my imaginary friend Cleo is from. LOL JK

4.description: This place is very clean and the staff is very attentive.The reason it gets 3 stars and not 4 stars is i've had better steak at other places in my tacos.etc.....But their best hidden gem that people are just starting to notice is their  al pastor,which is amazing almost as good and some times better than atotonilco.And the big bonus is that they have a special taco of the week for only $1.25  usually $1.75.You just can't find good full size tacos not those slider wannabe mini tacos for under $2.00.And they have two nice tv's on each side of the place to watch.And probably the biggest thing is that they sell beer!!!!!Yea tacos and beer can't beat that.

3.description: it's been a while since i was last here, received an invite to go on monday night, as a girl in my party said " this is sum hood shit', they are redeemed by $1.50 drinks, anything except for remy and patron. did you hear me $1.50, i had two vodka drinks with double shots for $6 and i was very nice ;). it does get crowded so get there early, i got  there around 9 by time i left there was a line outside. the barmaid told me on tuesdays they have $1.50 beer and $4 long islands on thursday. monday is the best $1.50!!!!!

1.description: We were looking for an after-dinner drink with friends after a great spicy meal at Garifuna Flava Belizan restaurant around the corner on 63rd (which we also recommend), and the super nice bartender suggested this place.  The other reviewers are all right about the 70s decor -- it's in pristine condition and not to be missed.  And the curved shape of the bar, coupled with the comfortable naugahyde padded seats, removed any awkwardness in trying to have conversation among four people seated along the bar.  The bartender was extremely pleasant, informed us about upcoming events and specials.  To top it all off, Bobby Bland and Al Green on the sound system.  Can't beat it -- we'll definitely head back there, even though it's a bit of a trek for us.

2.description: Been a few years since I visited this place... despite being listed as "Club 6601", the sign outside calls it the Sexty Sex Lounge.  Don't let that name fool you- it's at sexty sex 01 S Western silly- nothing too dirty going on inside!It's just a friendly, mostly black neighborhood corner bar.  The decor was really something special, in about 1978!  Orange vinyl and chrome and mirrors everywhere.  I met friendly folks having a beer or two and not giving the geeky white guy and his friend a hard time at all for playing tourist at their bar.  Was a good place, with good people- and I got to pretend I was old enough to be drinking in the 70s- beat that!

0.description: Been a minute since I've been here.  The sexty sex is the plushiest bar I've ever been to.  Friendly folks at the classy feeling corner bar.  Classy cos its totally devoid of liquor posters.  Nothing but red vinyl and mirrors.  Stiff drinks and stiffer long islands, free food on sundays ('uh free soul food but sometimes it was chilly dogs?')   Recommend for a week night, don't for a friday or saturday unless you know some people from around the way cos it gets a little buck.

1.description: My parents used to come here, now despite living a bit far off I make my drive down here for my telera and/or bolillo bread (mexican sándwich bread). Soft Conchas aré my kids favorite, the sugar toped toasty ones are my favorite conchas. My parents continue to drive down here as well, through all these years the quality has remained the same as it is a family run business. Highly recommended as I have converted quite a few family and friends and they have become Loyal customers themselves :)

2.description: This place usually has great cake. This cake today is just horrible! I'm so upset

0.description: So after a bad experience down the street with another neighborhood restaurant I was still intent on keeping my money in the neighborhood.  So for my fiance's birthday I went here.  Great choice, great cake and even better price.  Language seemed like it would have been a problem but I guess they just know what they are doing he knew exactly what i wanted and that was what reflected on the end product.  Id give them a 10 if I could.

3.description: First time ordering and was not disappointed! The finished product was so beautiful, It was more perfect then what I had it pictured in my head. The Red Velvet was moistured and everyone loved it. So happy and without a doubt will order again!

1.description: They did an amazing job with my boyfriends cake. Not only were they really helpful but their customer service is great overall.  Nevertheless their cakes are delicious. I would definitely recommend.

2.description: I ordered communion cookies, for my daughter. They did a very nice job.  I am not giving them a ten because the decor was a bit off. I think that this franchise is part of Pierre's owners.. or affiliated somehow.  The prices are fair and the craftsmanship is very good. I will order again.

9.description: Welcome to the Neighborhood!  Love this place ! the greatest pastries & cakes and has seats to enjoy our coffee :) , had my son birthday cake from viva cake and it was great masterpiece and also was great

10.description: It's a great bakery that also has a cafe seating area inside. I had my son's cake made here and was amazed with the job they did. It's hard to find a bakery that can work with your ideas and make them a reality.  My son was excited when he seen his 3D cake. I would recommend this place for sure.

4.description: Best flan I've ever had and the staff is very friendly as well. I brought the flan to a family halloween party and people were still talking about it the next day.

6.description: Best 3 leches cake I've tasted! Yummy treats and great looking cakes. The customer service is an added plus, they really appreciate your business and are very nice!

11.description: Love Love LOVE this place!  So happy to see a new business in the neighborhood!  I don't have a sweet tooth, or rather DIDN'T have a sweet tooth but now I'm hooked! Great Pastries & the owner is a gem. You won't be dissapointed~

5.description: My wife and I just happened to be walking past the bakery and decided to check it out. We ended up ordering a graduation cake and bought some treats for the road. Veronica provided great customer service. She was extremely helpful and patient. The cake was everything we expected plus much more. Excellent customer service, excellent prices, and delicious pastries. Will be back again for the next occasion or sweet tooth.

7.description: They recently opened up and I loved their bakery items. The pastries are not only inexpensive but also delicious. I would recommend them to anyone, they also have some innovative ideas for cake designs. On tops of that the service is also impeccable.

8.description: Yum yum yum, this bakery has such great looking and tasting cakes, there is never any cake left when I serve these cakes at my party and with good reason. Even though they are far from my home I have found my perfect bakery.

0.description: Great cakes! Red velvet cake and their Flan is amazing

12.description: This place is pretty damn good as far as jibaritos go! Best jibarito around town, definitely better than Sobre El Fuego which is right down the street (just east of 63rd &Kedzie). Wouldnt say better than Cafe Caribe's food in general, but very good stuff considering that it is hard to find a good PR place if any on the southside. I have gotten the chicken jibarito from here twice and it is great and it is big compared to other PR places that generally serve their sandwiches small. Their alcapurria taste very fresh and non of their plates were overally greasy. This is my go to PR spot by my house. If your thinking you want a nice sized sandwich with flavor and want a deal, choose this place you'll get full :)

7.description: I went back after getting my hair cut. I felt like having some thing warm and low and behold there was Sancocho! (especially in this cold!) I brought some to my wife and she totally enjoyed it to the max! Also, I had some pastelillos of ground meat and guava paste & cheese. They were both homemade and delicious! Don't forget to try the flan which is to die for.Weeepa!

3.description: It's true. The jibarito is a good sandwich. I'm not a big steak person, but I did enjoy the sandwich. I really liked the rice. I can eat that rice 24/7. The staff was pretty nice too. I look forward to returning. I'd like to try the potato salad and the pork chops.

1.description: This is as good as it gets for real puertorican food in the southside. I am telling you, This place is a gem! We had a jibarito with rice and gandules  and it was finger licking good! Literally! The Plantain was so fresh yet toasty. The meat was great quality.My son had the carne encebollado and he is a picky eater. He asked for seconds. The potato salad was so awesome. Tip!!! Save room for dessert!  They have regular flan and wait for it...   coconut flan. They deliver, do carry out and catering.I highly recommend this place for breakfest, lunch and dinner.They open 7 days a week and Sundays until 2pm. I promise, this has been the best Puerto Rican restarant so far if not the only one on the southside of Chicago. I did speak to the owner and it turns out he went to culinary school. So he knows how to cook food. And Puerto Rican food is not an exception.

2.description: Love this place... Great empanada's, sandwiches are great and service is fast. This is real Puerto Rican food. I always call my order ahead of time and when I walk in the door my food is always ready.

9.description: Totally a worth while place to check out if you want some PR food on the south side. First time here, had the egg and cheese breakfast sandwich and it was gr8! Cool vibe its a little whole in the wall so don't expect much in the form of scenery but the food is good!

10.description: BLT was huge and great! They make their own hot sauce and it is spectacular and very flavorful.

13.description: I had been meaning to stop in for awhile was hesitant because ive been spoiled my whole life with good PR food at home so reluctantly I stopped in and to my surprise this place is the bomb.com  . man the tripleta took me back to the island terrific & I had an alcapurria fantastic  clean & great service .place should be on Chicago's Best:) south side is on the map with this place!!!!

16.description: I'm glad I found this place. Hard to find a good Puertorican restaurant in the Southside of Chicago. This place is not just "average good", it's pretty damn good! All their sandwiches are delicious and very cheap. They only set you back around $4.00! The owner is very nice and helpful, keeps the place spanking clean. Most people go their for sandwiches but I would recommend them try their entire cuisine. The bistec encebollado (steak n onions) platter is delicious, the arroz con gandules that comes with the platter is also good, but I prefer the white rice with red beans (habichuelas guisadas). Trust me, I'm a hard critic when it comes to Puertorican food. This place, being a southside joint, is tremendously good. I stopped going to Kapeekoo (on Pulaski) because of this place, and consequently, Kapeekoo is now closed.

15.description: must say first time im eating here and im hooked... good prices, excellent food and the employees are super nice! def recommend to any one and i will be back

0.description: The food was excellent, authentic . Best jibarito sandwich and yucca alcapurrias. The rice and beans was yummy! !! Recommended.

5.description: The steak jibaritos  with rice are delicious! Although the rice doesn't have olives which is what I'm used to seeing in PR rice. I've had the empanadas and they are absolutely great, not greasy at all. The coconut flan is AMAZING! I bought some today, my 4 year old daughter ate it all. Friendly staff. Not a fancy place by any means but great food. Now I don't have to travel all the way to the north side for a jibarito.

11.description: The food is delicious, the prices are extremely reasonable and the portions were big. This was our first visit, but sure won't be our last. The Lechon was so flavorful and the Jibarito was fantastic. Let's not even mention how amazing the coconut flan is since I want to make sure they don't run out when i go back. Lol.  My boyfriend grew up with his mom's Puerto Rican food....and this ranked right up there with hers. Steve, the owner and chef was so nice. We ate dinner there and took a carry out order for the next days lunch. We will be back for sure!

8.description: I live on the southside by midway and My co-worker and I were craving jibaritos, we found this place and the food is soooo delish!!! Great service! And the coconut flan was amazing!!! Defintely going back soon!!!! Great food!

4.description: For great Puerto Rican food at a great price this is your south side spot. Loved the jibaritos and simply made potato salad reminded me of my mommas. Service was excellent and metered street parking was in abundance. No alcapurrias for us since we were told they sell out fast but good to know for future visits.

14.description: So I have been here a few times and have ordered for take out or delivery a few other. I am happy there is a place like this close to work. I have had sandwich de pernil (pork), jibarito, sides are few but very good.  The arroz puertoriqueno is very good, not too greasy without sacrificing any flavor. I also tried the empanadas de guayava, they are good. The size of the sandwiches is unbelievably huge at a really cheap price. The service is excellent. The owner/cook is really nice and helpfulThe place is very simple and clean.  This place is good for lunch or take out. Would not be good for a romantic dinner or upscale service. BTW, they have delivery, which is helpful when I don't want ot drive.The sandwich break has some real good food, better prices and helpful service.

6.description: Food was amazing,  pretty good service,  definitely will be back..... I used tolive on the north side and tried the best places,  this ranks right up there with them...

3.description: Great food went here with my mom and her boyfriend. Our server was very nice and the portion sizes are good. I would recommend this restaurant for anyone looking for Mexican food.

1.description: I've been visiting this spot for over 20 years...I usually love this Pepe's but things are changing...  The portions are getting smaller and the taste just isn't the same. I went in this weekend and ordered a Mar Y Tierra (skirt steak or grilled chicken with 4 Jumbo Butterfly Shrimp) and when I got my order I was bamboozled. There were 5 medium - large shrimp that were not butterflied. Of course they said they changed the shrimp but the menu should change too. I love shrimp and can usually tell the difference between Jumbo and regular shrimp so I was quite disappointed that I didn't get what was stated in the menu. On another note: I'm sure I will still visit this spot but not as frequently as normal. It is a good spot for drinks and to bring the kids because they let u change the TV in the back. I'm  just disappointed with the flavor going down hill.

2.description: Im sorry everything sucked

9.description: This location is awesome!  Their steak fajitas are so delicious.  They come out sizzling and in heaping amounts.  The long islands are their staple drink!  Jose is a master at making them since he's been doing it for 30 years!  In fact, the same people have worked there since I was a kid.  I will be 30 next month.  Chile con queso is bomb!  That's all I have to say about that!

10.description: I have been goint to this restaurant for the past 16 years. Wonderful food, fun staff especially Cecilio. Do not forget the best Pina colada in town.

4.description: THE WORST 'MEXICAN" food that I have EVER tasted!!!! And I LOVE Mexican food so I have tasted PLENTY!We were a party of 4..First up-A TERRIBLE Margarita with Very little alcohol...we were the ONLY customers for like 20 min so I should have known better to eat there-NEVER.TRUST.A.REST….CUSTOMERS!But,u guys know that.My hunger got the best of me that day and we were tired of looking for a place to eat.Second Boo boo-Long island iced tea made with $5 Rum..YUCK.Listen guys,Im no stranger to the bottle so I really know my liquors.and EVERY time I drink SUPER cheap rum I get sick...I got sick(later at home)..The waitress was nice,slow,but nice...There was also some random guy who seemed to work everywhere.Ceasar? O.K now on to the scary part.NO ONE liked their food.HOW do you muck up a taco? The "beef" filing was awful and it looked like chewed up food.My friend said that her steak meat for the fajita tasted like dog food.She also ordered fries that came out not cooked all the way.I had some type of combo that had a taco,tostada,COLD BEANS,Rice(EEEEEEEW) and some other garbage.I could go on and on....but I wont and you have been WARNED!(True Story)..My son is a human garbage disposal.He is tall for his age and super greedy.I brought the food home to him and the next day it was STILL in the fridge with a few bites taken off...If his greedy a$$ wont eat their food its a Wrap..SHUT IT DOWN!!!!(in my Gordan Ramsey voice lol).

6.description: I love Their Mango margaritas at this pepes !!!! & with  this heat wave I love ,,, that I have pepes a block away ,,, I love the bartender Jose he's the friendliest and happiest man ,,,, I love sitting at the bar with their nice flat screen TVs ,, there's always games on and at one point ,, I even saw the novelas :))) love it !!!!!!!!!!!!!!

11.description: I hate to admit it, but I have been going to this Pepe's for over 20 years.  While I suppose that some purists could argue that the cuisine is more Tex-Mex than authentic Mexican and to a certain extent this could be true, nevertheless the food is outstanding.  I have been to a variety of Mexican restaurants and I have never found a carne asada with the juiciness and flavor of their carne asada.  Also I have enjoyed and occasionally crave their tostadas suizas.  You can have half a carne asada (and that is equivalent to about a whole carne asada at many Mexican restaurants)  along with a side item (tostada, enchilada, etc) along with rice and beans (their frijoles are absolutely perfect) for $9.25 - I would say one of the best food values in the city.  Their Margaritas are delicious and a lot of people love their Long Island iced teas (although I have not tried the latter).The service is good, the atomosphere is very pleasant.  It's hard not to love this place!They do have parking - but it is EAST of the restaurant although it appears that it would be west  (it's hard to explain but take my word for it).  Check when you park!

5.description: I have been going to this pepes for years. I have been a loyal customer. The past month I have notice a change in the customer service. I have been been treated extremely rude by the bartender "Jose". It got to the point that I needed to take a friend with me to translate to me the mean things that was being said to me by Jose in Spanish. He was calling me ugly instead of my name. Not to mention the horrible talk about my guest to his fellow co workers. The cook was using the washroom and on several time was seen using it and not washing her hands after exiting the washroom. This was very disgusting.  I'm glad I had my friend translate everything. I will never go back to this restaurant again and I plan on contacting their boss to complain.

8.description: I say definitely go to this place for the steak & chicken mariachis (shish kabobs) and the long island iced tea. F.Y.I. the long islands are actual drinks not just that pre-made mix stuff. definitely the drink to get you where you wanna go ;)Sure it's definitely not authenic mexican cuisine... but the booze makes up for that =P

0.description: This is not like any other Pepe's I have been to - and I tried MANY hoping for a place like this.  I couldn't find one, so this is it.  People that used to live around here on the southwest side still find their way to the bar on some evenings from as far away as Mokena.  You always come back here.  The food quality and service - and the drinks made by Jose at the bar are what you go here for.  It's a comfortable place where you want to hang out and have a few drinks and chat it up with friends or make new ones.I've been going here since 1992, and it has remained consistent.  Jose IS this Pepe's as far as I'm concerned, it wouldn't be the same without him!  People at the bar tell me stories of how they've been coming since the 80's and it has remained consistent (other than price inflation).Food recommendations:  Steak, chicken, pork, chorizo tacos, chicken mariachis, any quesadillas, any fajitas, carne asada dinners.... just about everything.   Ask for the "macho sauce" if the amazing table salsa doesn't burn you and you want to feel some heat.Drinks:  LONG ISLAND ICED TEA is what they have been known for since Jose touched a bottle of tequila.  This is the signature drink of this place, ask anyone sitting at the bar and they will tell you the same.  Margaritas second (on the rocks), and a good selection of top shelf tequila (you can request that your drink be made with Don Julio or Tres Generations etc for an extra charge).  People come here to hang out at the bar, talk, drink, eat and watch TV/sports.  There are two TVs at the bar, always great conversation - and if no one is there, Jose will keep you good company!  A cold can of Modelo with lime in a frosty mug is great too, as they have a full selection of Mexican beers.Summary:  This is no ordinary Pepe's.  Take what you know about Pepe's food, service and atmosphere of other locations and walk into this one as if it were another restaurant.  Sit at the bar, order a long island, get the macho sauce for your chips.  It'll be a GREAT night!   Friday and Saturday nights are the best nights to go hang out.  The neighborhood can be a little "iffy" at night, but you will be fine inside the restaurant and the police station is right down the street.  Just hide your valuables before you park your car here just in case!  It's WORTH IT!

1.description: This is the real deal!!!I found this place on a magazine ad dining at a restaurant. I am always up for checking new places so had to check it out.I was there with a friend Tuesday around 7 PM. We park right in front and and go inside. The restaurant is typical of many Mexican seafood restaurants with plastic sharks, trees and a hammock right in the middle high on the ceiling. We sit and the waitress comes with the menus, some ceviche, tostadas, crackers and habanero salsa. We ordered carne Zamora, piña rellena and langostinos, jarrito de mandarina and we are cool. I did not know that it is BYOB, I would've brought some coronas or tequila. Oh yea is BYOB.My friend gets a tostada, puts some ceviche and stats spooning habanero salsa like is ketchup. I tell him "hey dude try it first, it might be hot". "I'll be ok" he replied. Lol needless to say he wasn't. Lets put it this way I saw a couple of tears on his face LOL. Now I have something to bash him with for months. Point being that habanero salsa is extremely hot, beware.After my laughing about my friend trying to get rid of the burn, we get  the food. Everything was delicious. The carne Zamora comes with a good size skirt steak, cooked to perfection, a quesadilla, Mexican chorizo, whole beans, rice, grilled green onions and jalapeño. Truly delicious combination. The langostinos are good, well seasoned (not too salty or over seasoned) fresh good quality prawns.But then, the piña rellena (stuffed pineapple) ....  Can't find the proper term to describe it without sounding like a teenager (erase: OMG, heavenly, seriously) f*^ing perfect. The perfect combination of flavors. Half pineapple, scooped out the flesh, grilled shrimp, octopus, fish cheese and broiled. You get the sweetness of the pineapple combined with the seafood and then a little bit of heat from the hot peppers and to top it off some melted cheese. This was some serious good eating. This comes with rice, salad, garlic bread and fries.After eating all that food I wished there was more pina rellena, not because I was still hungry, or the portion (portions are huge) but because that is one of those addicting flavors that you can't stop eating (or at least I).  Yeap it was that good.Can't wait to come back on a week end. I think they have music or karaoke. At least that is what the waitress told me, service is super nice and attentive. They checked on us a few times throughout the dinner. When we got the check I was surprised the prices are reasonable here. CASH only, LOL I learned that the hard way.MMLB,  great food, reasonable prices, good service, cash only and BYOB

2.description: This place has really good food. It is spacious & the also have carne Asada for those who don't eat seafood. If I recall correctly it's BYOB, the food is delicious & it's usually never too packed. Good customer service as well.

0.description: This is my ultimate seafood place!!!  This place is by far thee best environment to have a great time at. The quality & portions of the food cannot be compared to other local seafood places. The waitress are amazing! Don Jose the chef is a great cook, and does a beautiful job! I had my baby shower in the side hall they have... That's how much I LOVE this place! Anyone who is looking for a great seafood place without over paying for their dinner, this is the place to be! And BYOB!!! Besides the fact that they also have alternative options for non sea food eaters!

1.description: better than anything you ever tasted

0.description: The chicken wings here are hands down the best chicken wings ever. Not too greasy, meat super tender. Plus! You get thirty wings and a butt load of fries for 20 bucks?! Dude, total hidden gem!
Pretty good. They have burgers stuffed with cheese. Probably bad for you, but taste Great !!!!

58.description: Garifuna is delicious and the folks are friendly.  It's great, it's always great, it's never not great.  Garifuna is worth any trip you have to make it.  If I had to eat Garifuna everyday, I don't think I would be unhappy.  It helps that the staff are all friendly, attentive, and informative.The lunch and dinner specials are a good bang for your buck.  It's a good idea to go with other people so you can sample appetizers and different meals - that being said, I've definitely gone with friends and all ordered the same thing.My favorites are the jerk chicken, love the peas, love the cabbage.  Nothing on the menu is bad.  I've never had problems with slow service, although at least once I've arrived during open hours to find them inexplicably closed.I've seen a few less than stellar reviews for Garifuna on account of their neighborhood, even one that suggested that it might not be safe for women.  As a woman, I honestly think these yelpers are out of their minds and I hope their statements would never dissuade anyone from visiting.  Sure, the surrounding blocks aren't tidy and picturesque, sure, there are kids hanging out on corners.  But it's safe and anyone who tells you otherwise is speaking out of fear, not with proof.

56.description: This place has character and delicious food.  Loved the conch fritter appetizer.  My $6 lunch special included 2 pieces Belizean stew chicken, rice and beans with a sauce you pour over it, sweet plantains, and stewed cabbage.  Every bite was delicious.  Tried a taste of the jerk chicken and potato salad side and both were great.  I would have paid 5 times what I did for these meals.  Great place to go with a group and perfect place to watch the World Cup.  A complete hole in the wall and I loved every detail.

29.description: Delicious food and a wonderful waiter! The chicken stew was flavorful. I enjoyed the rice and plantains on the side. It complemented the chicken. Both desserts were yummy...sweet potato cake and butter cake with dulce de leche...served warm.

42.description: Found this place on yelp and dropped by a few hours before closing time on a Saturday night. Was greeted warmly by who I assume to be either the owner or the owner's son. Definitely a family owned and run restaurant. Despite the kitchen nightmare esque decor, the food was great. On second thought, the homely look was a perfect match for the  "home-cooked" style of the food. We ordered the panades, conch fritters, Jamaican jerk chicken (came with a side of rice and cabbage), oxtail stew, and an extra side of plantains. Both the panades and conch fritters were excellent, especially with the cabbage sauce it came with. All in all, the appetizers and sides seemed to shine more than the main dishes, but it was still all  very delicious. Will definitely come again! Don't forget the yelp check-in for 10% off!

23.description: Maybe daughter and I went to Garifuna Flava for the first time on Sunday of this week, the food was the very best I've had in a long time everything was seasoned just right and to find a place like this in the hood, this is a gem. And to find out it's bend here for 7 years I was shocked.  Everyone need to go out and try Garifuna Flava it' s great

47.description: I used to come on here and blast them for poor service, but I stand forever corrected.  I don't care if I wait two hours this food is worth the wait.  My mainstay is the white meat jerk chicken dinner.  I've come here about 5 times in a row and if nothing else this food is consistently delicious.  For the sides I have cabbage which is sweet a little sour.  My other sides were beans, rice and plantains.  All were skillfully prepared. On a whim I tried the panades.  Fun fact = I abhor fish.  The panades were magnificent crispy fried with yummy sauce and sadly they didn't make it home. I would highly recommend this place.  Yes, service is slow, but it is family run with a whole lotta love.  The staff is friendly, so be patient and kind.  Lastly,  please try the Belizean Long Island, it will make your night magical.

8.description: Garifuna Flava has pretty good food and I'm glad it is in the location that it is in. Growing up in Englewood, I was always disappointed in the lack of food options. How many times can one eat from the same Chinese restaurant, really? I still have family in the area, so today on a visit I decided to try out this restaurant.      There were two other people ordering with me and we placed a pretty large carry out order. We were told 20 minutes, and when we arrived it was all ready to go. We ordered the panades, conch fritters, conch soup, plantain chips and guacamole, and the Jamaican jerk and Belizean stew chicken lunch specials. I was so surprised when the total was less than 45 bucks!      Now onto the food: the panades had a good flavor, but I would have preferred a bit more filling. The plantain chips and guacamole were delicious and the portion size was great. The conch fritters were huge and were so delicious-definitely my favorite out of what we tried. They could have been a tad less greasy, though. The side conch soup was actually huge and full of veggies and seafood.      The lunch specials came with some side choices and we chose rice and beans, garden salad, potato salad, and stewed cabbage so we could try it all. The chicken in both lunch specials was flavorful and not dry. The jerk sauce was good too. Out of our sides, the cabbage was definitely the best. My husband enjoyed the potato salad, but he was literally given a tablespoon's worth. That was truly the only bummer out of our experience.      If you're in the area, definitely try this place out. I also read that there will be a buffet and drink specials for the upcoming Mayweather-Pacquiao fight so it might be a good time to dine in!

31.description: This restaurant is a hidden gem in the area I work in the area and I honestly wish we had more businesses like it, if I could give more than five stars I would

34.description: Soooooo I plan on going to the actual restaurant location very very soon. For those that work downtown definitely take advantage of Nosh Market at Block 37 (extended through March). I stumbled upon Garifuna and ordered the jerk chicken plate (jerk chicken, red rice and beans, and plantains) Every item was delicious. The jerk chicken was flavorful and whatever green sauce that was on the side was good! I like the red rice and beans had a spicy kick to them. The plantains were sweet and not overdone. I cannot wait to bring my mom to the actual location. That caramel pound cake is calling my name!

16.description: The food was amazing. I took the family and we had stewed ox tails, jerk chicken, king fish and a number of appetizers (panades, conch frittes and plantain chips). The cabbage was the best I've had in a long time. Tons of flavor, great service and decent price. The server even memorized our order and it was 6 of us, with very different meals.  We will be back!

13.description: Ordered takeout here.  Pretty good Caribbean food.  However this wouldn't be my choice of foods to eat, however we wanted something different.  Anyways, I tried the sautéed shrimp, jerk chicken, plantains, beans and rice and some panades.  Shrimp were good, but, not that much included in a dinner order.   The jerk chicken was good. And you get a whole half chicken.   Panades were good as well.  Never had them, but I enjoyed.  The plantains were OK, but I'm not a fan of them overall.  Rice and beans were really good.  I liked how it was seasoned.  Definitely a good place to try and they've been featured on check please.  Plus they aren't too far from my house.   I might check them out again.

11.description: These wonderful folks catered our work lunch today and it was a scrum amongst us all for seconds and thirds. MAN was it delicious! Stew & jerk chicken were fall-off-the-bone good, plantains were perfect, and rice and beans excellent. Really wonderful stuff.

39.description: I went with my regular brunch crew and I must say we were not disappointed.We saw the place on DDV and got to meet the owner. Really cool guy.We basically ordered every appetizer and they were all delicious. My favorite was the chicken tamale. It took a little long to get everything, but we could tell it was all made with love by the owner's mom! (Yes his mom is the chef!!!!)

37.description: I went here for dinner with a coworker/friend and the food was absolutely amazing. The business is family-run, and I was treated like I was part of a big family. I brought home leftovers and they didn't make it to the next day. Absolutely fantastic.

0.description: Garifuna is fantastic. There are some dishes which are outstanding, and some which are 'merely' good.Outstanding list:5: that stew-oxtail. "Our meats are marinated with bell pepper, onions, vinegar, paprika & black pepper, then slow stewed and baked to perfection. Very tender and packed with flavor. All entrees are served with choice rice & beans, stew beans or split peas, fried ripe plantains and choice salad." KILLER. I can't phrase it better than them.Good list:4: Appetizer 331 platter. Those wings were killer, probably better than Nandos in seasoning and tenderness. I straight recommend getting just the wings over this, because the other 2 elements were just a-ok.4: Conch soup and Hudut Baruru I recommend as well.4: Red Snapper "This very popular white fish is delicate to the core. Served whole, it is deep fried & garnished in a sweet pepper, tomato, purple onion & garlic based creole sauce."Whoaw. Extremely fresh and well cooked, still lacking the extra oomph to reach oxtail level.2: Pigtail, it's an acquired taste. We were too full to try dessert, especially after the coconut-rice, stew beans, and fried plantains.WOW.

38.description: Took the trek over to Garifuna Flava on a Friday night with some friends. We had previously made reservations but we were only one out of three groups here. I agree with most of the other reviews, order all the appetizers! They are all great and really cheaply priced. The guacamole wasn't great, but the conch fritters and panades made up for it. The entrees were good as well but I'm pretty sure we could've just ordered the rice and beans and been satisfied. We had the stewed beef, shrimp, and conch soup. We ordered some of the signature cocktails and even being Caribbean styled, they were tasty and not too sweet. Our waiter was friendly enough but wasn't super knowledgable about the menu and couldn't answer some of our questions about the menu. Overall, it's a great place to stop if your in the neighborhood.

51.description: Garifuna Flava makes everything from scratch. If you enjoy caribbean-style cuisine, you will definitely enjoy the Traditional Belizean stewed chicken which is perfection in a bowl. It had a reddish color due to Recado (also known as "Achiote"), which is a commonly known spice in Belize. It is known for providing an amalgamation of slightly sweet and peppery flavors to stews, fish, chicken, beef, soups and sauces. It is the "Holy Grail" of spices in Belize. The food here is truly hearty, delectable, bright, bold and ethereal. I had the chicken stew ($5.95), and opted for the rice and beans which is a ubiquitous local dish in Belize. It was served with sweet plantains which were tender and excellent. My husband had the pot roast beef stew($6.95) which was incredibly flavorful and a gastronomical surprise! We both came to a mutual agreement (which doesn't happen very often in our marriage) that everything here is off-the-chart 5-star worthy. The only negative is that we didn't see anything on the their menu with coconut sauce, such as, Belizean Chicken in coconut sauce. This is NOT a Jamaican restaurant, so don't confuse it with Jamaican cuisine just because you see "Jerk Chicken" on the menu. When you eat a super hot chili pepper, you might sweat, burn the roof of your mouth, shed a few tears and your nose may even start running. To some people, this is a dining bliss experience. Not me. I don't want to be in pain when I eat. I don't want to cry when I eat. Think of comparing Jamaican jerk chicken and Belizean jerk chicken against a habanero pepper versus a jalapeno pepper. The habanero pepper has 40 times more heat than the jalapeno pepper.What we ordered was marinated with bell peppers, onions, vinegar, paprika and black pepper. The meats simmer for hours which makes them incredibly luscious, tender and succulent. We went here for lunch on Sunday, and started with the jerk chicken wings which had the right amount of kick. We also tried the conch fritters, with a crispy exterior and a tender melt-in-your mouth interior. These reminded me of cod fritters that my mom used to make for us when I was much younger. The conch fritters were ethereal and prodigious! We left here satisfied, electrified and our palates gratified.We never would have known about Garifuna Flava had it not been for them being at the Lakeview Taco Fest in 2014. They were serving up jerk chicken tacos worthy of more than 5-stars. Seriously! I recommend going here for lunch (they close at 8 pm on Sunday). The lunch portions were generous and very reasonable. My husband practically made love to his dessert: The caramel pound cake (also known as "Milk Cake") which he said was "really outstanding!" We are already planning a return visit, but next time, it will be dinner. The restaurant is bright, clean, welcoming and colorful. The employees were very hospitable, and we were made to feel like we were long-time customers. This is more than a 5-star worthy restaurant. Seriously.This restaurant was featured on "Check Please!" It was also featured on the "Food Network," "The Hungry Hound" and "Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives."Price Point = 5 starsService: 5 starsLunch for two people (with water only) was under $30 and slightly over $25 (plenty of food for sharing too)

27.description: Totally awesome food!!!! I had the Chicken Jerk. The chemistry with the Jerk Sauce and the seasoning on the chicken... oh. my. god!! Amazing :) I thoroughly enjoy the beans and rice too, especially with the gravy it came with! Nom nom nom :) Would definitely go back and recommend it to others!

32.description: Very delicious, despite the Caribbean jerk chicken being smaller in proportions than I'm use to I have no qualms with either the flavor or the service. I can honestly say I do not remember the last time I dined out and had as genuinely nice servers. Both had an air of happiness and friendliness i felt was contagious and that added to the experience.The sides were a fried plantain: perfectBeans and rice: good but a little dryGravy for beans and rice: perfect and negated any dryness resulting in singing taste buds.I'd also recommend trying a Caribbean soda, I got pineapple ginger and wow. I have never had that combination and truly have been missing out.Great food, service, and its something out of the ordinary.

54.description: Honest review do not go here i went because it was in diners drive in an dives the food was not good i was so disappointed like its nothing special i would not go there ever again it is honestly not good

48.description: Staff had a little attitude. Besides that the food was good. I would go again.

44.description: Was lookeing for something different and reasonably priced.   GF hit the spot.   We started with conch fitters and panadas.   The fritters were insanely moist and flavorful.  Two of us got jet chicken and the other stewed chicken.   We tried the potato salad, rice and beans and plantains.  Everything was fresh and delicious.    We were loving it so much we ordered desert, which we never do.... Sweet potato cake.    Tasted like it had just emerged from the oven...moist and tender.   Can't wait to go back

24.description: They came to my job today, and after reading such great reviews, i was eager to try it. I had the following:Stew Chicken: I really loved the stew chicken. Extremely flavorful and the meat would fall right off of the bone. Will definitely be my 'go to' dish when i visit their actual restaurant. I've never liked stew chicken from other restaurants i've tried, but they hit it right on the nail with how they prepare it.Jerk Chicken: It wasn't bad, but i've had better in Chicago. As mentioned in a previous review, the jerk chicken isn't spicy at all and almost tasted like normal bbq chicken...but what made me like it, is when i dipped the chicken in the side of green sauce they give you. Once i did that, then the jerk chicken had a chance. Rice and Beans: Extremely good, great texture, and especially loved the gravy that they pour on top of it. Was the best rice and beans i've ever had. Would definitely order this again.  Cabbage: The cabbage was good, it had a hint of spiciness to it which i loved about it. No complaints here and would order this side again.Overall the food was great. I almost feel like i was charged a premium for the fact they were bringing the food to my company vs. me picking the food up at their actual restaurant. Paid $25 for all of the food above, and each were in very small containers. Hope when i visit the restaurant the portions are a bit bigger for the cost, but overall good! It was great to see a restaurant thats located on the south side of chicago, come downtown to participate in the FOODA program. Keep up the hard work!

7.description: I am not use to this type of food but I definitely enjoyed the conch fritters. It was so good.  The service is like your at home having a meal with family. Not your family, a Belize family that can cook!

49.description: Sigh... so close, and yet so far.......In Belizean:Me wan gih Garifuna Flava da 5 star, but ah can't yet.  Yah man, dey cook authentic, but da no de bes' belize food i evah git.  Eh good, doh!  Ah mi get di rice an' beans wih stew chicken, plantain, deh potato salad, deh panades, an' deh conx flittas.  Alla deh tings look good an' taste good, buh sumtin' jus' a lee bit off wih each plate fram wha' ah grow up wit.  Stew chicken mih good, buh ah guess ah' git tuh use tuh dah way ah mek it ah home.  Dat potato salad wih deh english creme good, man!   Dih panades wih deh hot peppah onions - yuh can't beat dat!  Even dah few fish bones noh botha' me none!  Conx flittas.... now dat dah mih mistake.  Ah grow up eatin' it fresh fram dih watah an' cook rite deh on dah key... so how Chicago gwen match dat when  eh gat no beach an' noh fresh conx.... Flava try hard, doh!  Ah mi drive ovah wan hour just fu do wan pickup.... su far weh... bu' yuh no find wan belizean restaurant in deh states often, so grab wen yuh can!.  In English:  I really want to give Garifuna Flava 5 stars, but I just can't yet.  Yes, they cook authentic, but it's not the best belizean food I've ever eaten.  It is good, though!  I ordered rice and beans with stewed chicken, fried plantains, belizean potato salad, panades, and conch fritters.All the dishes looked and tasted good, but there was something just a tiny bit off on each dish compared to what I grew up with.  The stew chicken was good, but I guess I'm too used to the way I make it at home.  The belizean potato salad with the english creme was good!  The panades with hot pepper onions... you can't beat that!  Even the few fish bones I encountered didn't bother me.  Conch fritters ... now that was my mistake.  I grew up eating them fresh from the sea and cooked right on the beach (cays).... so how could Chicago match that when there's no beach and no fresh conch.... ?  Garifuna Flava tries hard, though!I drove over an hour just to do a pick-up order... so far away.... but you don't find a Belizean restaurant in the US very often, so grab it while you can!

40.description: ahhhh...I Absolutly  love, love, love eating here! Their long Island ice tea is yummy and very pinapple-y. The jerk chicken is superb and their Guacamole with the Plantain chips are just to die for. It's a mom and pop place so I love supporting them. They do close early like 8pm so if you crave their food like I do... make plans to go early. They are also closed on Mondays so that's a bummer. The customer service is always great and they have a special drink (I don't know the name but if you ask about it I am sure they will know what i am talking about).When you drink it...it sooths your throat, clears your nostrils and warms up you tummy. It's magical. I swear by it. It is liquor so bring your ID. Overall Absolutly awesome comfort food. I definite recomend going at least once.

53.description: Below  was my review after really a bad day.   The owner has since rectified the situation and we are on good terms.   I am now a happy customer again.   I would recommend this place given the gestures made and how the owners me feel like they cared about me.  I was angry bcuz I got ill from eating something I was allergic to and I am still sick from it.  It is going to take me 6 months to recover,  so I was very emotional when I wrote this initial review.   That being said, I left the comments up below to show how nice the owners were and that they actually won me over, after all the drama. Overall, they have good good food and the family that owns this place is really nice.   I was just a victim of coincidence I guess.Old review I updated... DON'T WASTE YOUR TIME!  I Have given this place several chances and today they have lost a customer!!!  They practically KILLED me on one visit bcuz of a severe allergy had.  I made the server aware and asked her at least 5 times if the food had what I was allergic to it and she got an attitude with me, told me she knew what she wad talking about.  I got VIOLENTLY ill the same night, called the restaurant the next day and they informed me my dish had the allergen in it and didn't know why the server didn't just check with the kitchen!!!!  That was my LAST visit.  I went on another occasion and they were out of Catfish (like they always are), so I ordered something else.   An entire HOUR later,  the guy comes back and says they ran out of cabbage too!  WTF? WHY WOULD YOU WAIT AN HOUR LATER TO TELL ME THAT.  I drove an entire 45 minutes to come and could have saved a lot of time if you just said what you were out of on the beginning!!! I was starving at that!  I hate this place.  They are always out of stuff and have poorly trained staff.  What if my allergic reaction ended up fatal???!!!

30.description: Overall, the food here is great. I was very skeptical to eat here because I'm not familiar with one belizean restaurant that has jerk chicken but no fry jack and no bun on the menu. I was able to completely ignore my rude date by stuffing my mouth with food. The panades is excellent!!!! The masa was perfect, well seasoned, and the fish was perfect. Now, I'm used to the big long panades my family makes but these little bite sized ones were so good and packed with flavor. The garnaches was made different than how we make it home but it was good. I just had to add more onion sauce, which was fresh and not watered down. I'm biased when it comes to tamales because I like the cull seasoned a certain way but the tamales here is well worth the try. Our server was pleasant, even though my date was totally rude, he was very accomodating and quick. The atmosphere is casual, they played a mix of soca, punta, and reggae music.The tv is where everyone can see it from the tables and bar. They also have Grace fruit juice! I wish they were located in a more central part of the city but its worth the trip.

46.description: A place that actually sums up what it is in its name, Garifuna Flava. This place has plenty of Flava! I dined in yesterday at Garifuna Flava. Upon getting there I was a little iffy because of the location and neighborhood its in, but despite the gloomy area, the restaurant is decently decorated & comfortable. I started off my dinner by ordering the Belizean long island which was recommended by my server (nice choice) and started with the 3-3-1 appetizer platter.  The 3-3-1 appetizer platter consisted of 3 jerk wings, 3 panes, and 1 garnache. Jerk wings were good, panes were excellent, and the garnache was delish! Panes are very similar to the latin empanadas, but belizean version. They were filled with fish mix and was perfectly crisp outside and cooked perfectly inside. Went well with the sauce too.  The garnache was my favorite, very similar to the mexican tostadas with beans, cheese, sour cream and etc. The garnache was a bit different, it included tostada, cabbage mix, cheeses, and ketchup sauce. I normally HATE eating ketchup on my food but this was the perfect exception. My main dish was the stew chicken, which was great!  It was packed with flavor and was served in stew sauce rather than in a stew.  It was medium spicey, kind of peppery, and the chicken was tender and falling of the bones. My overall experience was awesome, server was nice and insightful (young black women with dreads),  good was perfectly cooked and seasoned, and the restaurant was cozy for a cold night. Definitely going back, it is a MUST try people!

1.description: Really solid food at a great price range. I really enjoyed the stewed oxtail and the red snapper was magnificent (a little pricey at $18... though). Also, their jerk chicken was phenomenal - very tender. The rice with mashed peas was really tasty. The service was lovely too... It's quite a hidden gem :). Check in on Yelp for a 10% discount!

55.description: Wow! My taste buds did not expect this most pleasant surprise! Jerk chicken is off the chain, Belizean chicken stew is tasty, guacamole had a perfect consistency and very flavorful (especially with the plantain chips), and the rice with gravy was scrumptious.. Will definitely be back for seconds, maybe later today

9.description: I went with my regular brunch crew and I must say we were not disappointed.We saw the place on DDV and got to meet the owner. Really cool guy.We basically ordered every appetizer and they were all delicious. My favorite was the chicken tamale. It took a little long to get everything, but we could tell it was all made with love by the owner's mom! (Yes his mom is the chef!!!!)

26.description: Garifuna Flava has pretty good food and I'm glad it is in the location that it is in. Growing up in Englewood, I was always disappointed in the lack of food options. How many times can one eat from the same Chinese restaurant, really? I still have family in the area, so today on a visit I decided to try out this restaurant.      There were two other people ordering with me and we placed a pretty large carry out order. We were told 20 minutes, and when we arrived it was all ready to go. We ordered the panades, conch fritters, conch soup, plantain chips and guacamole, and the Jamaican jerk and Belizean stew chicken lunch specials. I was so surprised when the total was less than 45 bucks!      Now onto the food: the panades had a good flavor, but I would have preferred a bit more filling. The plantain chips and guacamole were delicious and the portion size was great. The conch fritters were huge and were so delicious-definitely my favorite out of what we tried. They could have been a tad less greasy, though. The side conch soup was actually huge and full of veggies and seafood.      The lunch specials came with some side choices and we chose rice and beans, garden salad, potato salad, and stewed cabbage so we could try it all. The chicken in both lunch specials was flavorful and not dry. The jerk sauce was good too. Out of our sides, the cabbage was definitely the best. My husband enjoyed the potato salad, but he was literally given a tablespoon's worth. That was truly the only bummer out of our experience.      If you're in the area, definitely try this place out. I also read that there will be a buffet and drink specials for the upcoming Mayweather-Pacquiao fight so it might be a good time to dine in!

25.description: i've had more than my fair share of jerk chicken and beans and rice, both here and in kingston, negril and montego bay.  but i'm telling you, this is the best freaking jerk chicken i've ever had.  the end.  and the beans and rice, about which i was super wary...uh-mazing!  they were at groupon today and i hope and pray they'll come back early and often 'cause i'd beg like james brown to get more. i'm spoiled and done with the others, whoever they are..

12.description: I've been dying to try this place..I figured today was a good day, because I came into the city to see the STANLEY CUP! !Ok.. so they were 7 minutes late in opening. The front window is cracked,  with some old, nasty tape holding it together. .They really should fix it, for curb appeal. .I ordered the panadas, which are served with a mild & a spicy cabbage sauce. They were good... don't know if I'd order them again.I had the BEEF STEW lunch special. ..with rice & beans, and  the Belize potato salad. .Two chunks of meat in a bowl??! And ...I think a.. plantain on the plate...which was old & cold tasting.The beef was fantastic. .as was the rice n beans..All of a sudden the music was all bass, and  hurting my ears!! It was vibrating in my chest...It was making it hard to enjoy my meal..

59.description: My thought after I left this place was "the drive there was interesting!"  But not so sure that the drive (from the city) was worth it.  I had the good fortune of hitting a couple of Caribbean cuisine places in 2 days and, arguably, in a good position to do a non-government funded test using unsophisticated sampling techniques.  I must say that while the offerings were solid at GF, there is betta cuisine from da islands in Chicago maan.  Them people at Ja Grill  be makin' some sweet delectables that be winnin' out in the yummy to the tummy department hands down man.  Them be putting out some righteous tastes there and while GF is good, I just think there are betta flavas in the city.

21.description: I am only giving 4 stars because although the food is AMAZING our waitress the last time we where there was inattentive, uninterested, and slow.

17.description: "Woohoo, as good as it gets" is right! I honestly wasn't expecting this place to be as good as it was!The plantain chips were enormously addictive. I didn't think they were anything special after the first bite, but a few chips later, I was hooked! The jerk chicken appetizer was just the right amount of spicy.The main dishes were where the meal really shined. My friend got the dish with the fish in a coconut broth, and oh my god was the broth the best fish broth I've ever tasted. I had no idea such a flavor combination existed! I got the conch soup which was also really good and incredibly hearty. I couldn't even finish half of it, I was so full by that point. This restaurant is a real gem! Somewhat of a hole in the wall place, but it's a place that puts all the letters (and an exclamation mark or two) in flavor. SOOO GOOD.

10.description: Great flavors on the brown stew chicken and the conch fritters were flavorful but over fried which had a lil burn taste to them...will try again!

5.description: Based upon the reviews, I decided to drag my little cousin along for a cultural dish. Overall, I love the food. It was the first time I ever try Belize meal and they make for great leftovers. It's really not that different from Jamaican and Haitian meals.The only thing I wasn't a fan of was the cabbage and potatoes salad. Yet, I will come back.

3.description: First off let's address the location. Sure it's not like some neighborhoods in the city. It has diversity, culture, people outside of their homes. In no way does that translate to me feeling unsafe at.all. On a Friday night there were several families in the place and even if I was by myself would have felt right at home. The staff was very friendly and worked their tail off to bus, seat and serve all customers.We ordered the conch fritters and panades which were both amazing. I think I preferred the fritters but you can't go wrong with either. For our main dishes we had the jerk chicken and the king fish. The chicken was amazing, smoked and seasoned perfectly. The fish was solid, a bit over cooked, but the sauce was very good and cabbage and rice and beans that came with it were bomb.com/wow. If you are looking for a great atmosphere and food that is not your "usual" cuisine please give this place a try.

35.description: Very delicious food. I had the chicken stew. Wish they gave more plantains but still good. Bringing my hubby back here. And they have wifi

19.description: Totally awesome food!!!! I had the Chicken Jerk. The chemistry with the Jerk Sauce and the seasoning on the chicken... oh. my. god!! Amazing :) I thoroughly enjoy the beans and rice too, especially with the gravy it came with! Nom nom nom :) Would definitely go back and recommend it to others!

28.description: Jerk chicken - Full of flavor and spice. Not overly hot as some jerk tends to be.Beans and rice - Great on its own, even better with the gravy that comes with it.Panades - Little pieces of happiness. A MUST have.King Fish w/ creole sauce - Yummy! Has a nice balance of sweet and hot.Jamaica cream soda is very good.This place is a gem! Great food, service, and very affordable. This was my first dining experience but it won't be my last. If you are in the area, give it a try!

45.description: Looked it up on "Diners, Drive-Ins, and Dives." Gave it a shot, and it was AWESOME. My girlfriend and I were eager to have something different in the city of Chicago, and this was the it. The minute we walked in we were greeted nicely by, what seem to be the owner. We had a great server and the food was great. Indeed a hole in the wall, but truly enjoyed it all and highly recommend it!

33.description: Don't know much about Belizean food for comparisons but the food here tastes good to me! Like the conch fritters and the stew beef is melt in your mouth good!

43.description: So we ordered a variety of menu items from conch fritters and panadas, to king fish and Carmel cake. Everything was completely delicious, but the star of the night was the sweet potato cake!  This cake will make you speechless! By far the highlight of my meal.

2.description: Great Caribbean food! The chicken was just right and the rice perfect. The drinks and the desserts go well with the meal. You have to try and be Irie as I was. Glad my coworker turned me onto this slice of paradise.

18.description: Had the Jerk chicken with rice and beans.....phenomenal.  Good amount of spice on the chicken, and an awesome little plantain that comes with it.

41.description: Ordered takeout here.  Pretty good Caribbean food.  However this wouldn't be my choice of foods to eat, however we wanted something different.  Anyways, I tried the sautéed shrimp, jerk chicken, plantains, beans and rice and some panades.  Shrimp were good, but, not that much included in a dinner order.   The jerk chicken was good. And you get a whole half chicken.   Panades were good as well.  Never had them, but I enjoyed.  The plantains were OK, but I'm not a fan of them overall.  Rice and beans were really good.  I liked how it was seasoned.  Definitely a good place to try and they've been featured on check please.  Plus they aren't too far from my house.   I might check them out again.

52.description: #TripleDIt's the flava that you savor!  The positive yelp reviews don't lie.  The food at Garifuna Flava is AWESOME!So many choices and very affordable for the amount of food you get. I ended up getting the Jerk Chicken, Panades, and washed it down with some kind of "Breeze" drink.  The Jerk Chicken is not like Jamaican Jerk.  This is food from Belize.  So, it's not as spicy.  One order is about half a chicken...so, I couldn't finish it.  The chicken has this smokiness with each bite that makes your mouth water for another bite.  I would recommend ordering this chicken with a friend or two and then getting some other dishes.  The sauces were awesome too!   The panades were excellent as well.  The fish inside was very delicious while the deep fried outside shell wasn't drenched in oil.  Habanero slaw (& the mild) were EXCELLENT!  I could put that stuff on hotdogs, hamburgers, tacos, sushi, cake...Every around me was ordering the Conch soup that looked so good.   That may be the better way to go if you're with a smaller party.  I also appreciated my waiter giving me a "BELIZE" tourist guide, just in case, I wanted to visit the country of Belize.  That was another first for me.    This is #56 on my quest to eat at all the Diners, Drive-ins, & Dives in America!

50.description: Authentic...Fresh...HomemadeThis place is for real. It may not look like much from the outside, but the food is fantastic.

4.description: They came to my job today, and after reading such great reviews, i was eager to try it. I had the following:Stew Chicken: I really loved the stew chicken. Extremely flavorful and the meat would fall right off of the bone. Will definitely be my 'go to' dish when i visit their actual restaurant. I've never liked stew chicken from other restaurants i've tried, but they hit it right on the nail with how they prepare it.Jerk Chicken: It wasn't bad, but i've had better in Chicago. As mentioned in a previous review, the jerk chicken isn't spicy at all and almost tasted like normal bbq chicken...but what made me like it, is when i dipped the chicken in the side of green sauce they give you. Once i did that, then the jerk chicken had a chance. Rice and Beans: Extremely good, great texture, and especially loved the gravy that they pour on top of it. Was the best rice and beans i've ever had. Would definitely order this again.  Cabbage: The cabbage was good, it had a hint of spiciness to it which i loved about it. No complaints here and would order this side again.Overall the food was great. I almost feel like i was charged a premium for the fact they were bringing the food to my company vs. me picking the food up at their actual restaurant. Paid $25 for all of the food above, and each were in very small containers. Hope when i visit the restaurant the portions are a bit bigger for the cost, but overall good! It was great to see a restaurant thats located on the south side of chicago, come downtown to participate in the FOODA program. Keep up the hard work!

6.description: Soooooo I plan on going to the actual restaurant location very very soon. For those that work downtown definitely take advantage of Nosh Market at Block 37 (extended through March). I stumbled upon Garifuna and ordered the jerk chicken plate (jerk chicken, red rice and beans, and plantains) Every item was delicious. The jerk chicken was flavorful and whatever green sauce that was on the side was good! I like the red rice and beans had a spicy kick to them. The plantains were sweet and not overdone. I cannot wait to bring my mom to the actual location. That caramel pound cake is calling my name!

22.description: Some of the best jerk chicken I have ever had. Love this place. Every time I go I get something different and I am thoroughly satisfied. Service is excellent and the place is clean. It's a diner so there isn't a lot of ambiance but the food and service make up for it if you are in to that sort of thing.

15.description: Ohhhhh this food is so good I came long distances to eat it again lol. The jerk chicken gives Jamaica competition, their stew chicken gives my moms Trinidad stew chicken good rivalry, the rice and beans r never dry, so moist and tasty, speaking of tasty, the sauces!!! Anything dat has a sauce is sooo good and compliments the food sublimely. The panades are so tiny n tasty it's a blissful surprise and the lil accompaniment with it was perfect. They have parking which is good, the place is clean cool n fresh, rastaman is usually dere n he is very nice, good service! Even if u r a foodie or not u jus need this food in ur life

57.description: "Woohoo, as good as it gets" is right! I honestly wasn't expecting this place to be as good as it was!The plantain chips were enormously addictive. I didn't think they were anything special after the first bite, but a few chips later, I was hooked! The jerk chicken appetizer was just the right amount of spicy.The main dishes were where the meal really shined. My friend got the dish with the fish in a coconut broth, and oh my god was the broth the best fish broth I've ever tasted. I had no idea such a flavor combination existed! I got the conch soup which was also really good and incredibly hearty. I couldn't even finish half of it, I was so full by that point. This restaurant is a real gem! Somewhat of a hole in the wall place, but it's a place that puts all the letters (and an exclamation mark or two) in flavor. SOOO GOOD.

20.description: Excellent food, largish portions and friendly service.They have some nice beers and have parking alongside the restaurant.Had the Ox-tail stew, jerk chicken, beef stew with rice. The portions were enough for 2 or more meals.

36.description: The food at this place is soooooo delicious.
