The drinks were made so well and refreshing.  Our server was super attentive.  Not a fan of the neighborhood but that won't stop me from going there again.  The place is just too good to pass up.  You can't go wrong with the appetizers and the jerk chicken.  I loved the gravy that accompanies the red beans and rice as well.  Try it.  You won't be sorry.

14.description: Found this place on yelp and dropped by a few hours before closing time on a Saturday night. Was greeted warmly by who I assume to be either the owner or the owner's son. Definitely a family owned and run restaurant. Despite the kitchen nightmare esque decor, the food was great. On second thought, the homely look was a perfect match for the  "home-cooked" style of the food. We ordered the panades, conch fritters, Jamaican jerk chicken (came with a side of rice and cabbage), oxtail stew, and an extra side of plantains. Both the panades and conch fritters were excellent, especially with the cabbage sauce it came with. All in all, the appetizers and sides seemed to shine more than the main dishes, but it was still all  very delicious. Will definitely come again! Don't forget the yelp check-in for 10% off!

1.description: Dry and tasteless ground beef and chicken tacos. This is a walk-up/drive thru spot.

0.description: It is a walk up and drive thru spot, but the food I usually order is great. The salsa with the chips has great unique flavor.  They deep fry their own chips too!  I usually get a steak torta on a regular basis.I did try the cheese and meat fries.  Excellent!  Not real good for you, but tasty!Only reason I put 4 instead of 5 stars is because it's only a drive-through place. Otherwise I love this place.

58.description: What a gem. I've been coming here on and off for about three years; it's a disservice to not have written a review until now. The downside for me is location - I live on the north side. That's probably a good thing, because I'd be there every day if I could.The coffee is really good, though not the best I've ever had. Robust stands out for a few reasons; their fantastic chai tea latte, great food, and consistently great service. My favorites among their many food items are the turkey and cranberry sandwich on a croissant and their cookies.Even if you don't live in the area, find a way to go check this place out. I used to do some work at the health clinic nearby, which was my original gateway to it. If you're a U of C student, do yourself a favor and make this your study spot.

56.description: I work on the Southside of Chicago and needed a place to get some work done in between commitments.  My friend recommended that I try out Robust instead of the usual Starbucks.  Their claim to fame is apparently the Mochadiablo, which was described to me as a mocha with habenaro sauce, so I of course, had to try it.  The spiciness was on the mild side, even for a coffree, and wasn't anything special.  I thought it was overpriced, even for a special coffee.  They have a lot of outlets around the perimeter of the shop, which makes it a good place to work.  I'd go back here again, but the coffee isn't anything to write home about.

29.description: I really like this place, but we tried to get seated today about 4pm and it was impossible. The line to order was all the way to the door. We got back in the car and went to Greenline.

42.description: Fantastic coffee and fantastic atmosphere. They have great mochas (I especially loved the mint one), and Belinda makes fantastic coffee art!

23.description: Awesome neighborhood coffee shop. I live down the street so I visit frequently. The staff is friendly, drinks are good, chill atmosphere, and the sandwiches and pastries are pretty tasty.

47.description: As an avid patron of this coffee shop since its opening. I was greeted by a horrible experience today. I had a conference call to conduct. I was late for the call and decided to sit down and make the call, I had every intention to purchase something once the call was completed. During the call, I was repeatedly harassed several times by a staff member and once by the owner of the establishment to buy something or leave! Now while I might have worn what you may consider "urban apparel" and not a tuxedo this is no way to treat a returning/potential customer! I felt embarrassed during the call with a new hire candidate to halt the call to reassure staff I was going to purchase an item. After the call I proceeded to the register to purchase a coffee and juice and wanted to voice my disappointing opinion to the owner. I was told he "left" no more than 10 minutes after confronting me. Whether he was there hiding or really did leave I left my business card and told the staff member who confronted me initially this is not a way to run a business. She began to dribble generalizations and decided to tell me that I was part of a problem that begun after I walked in and another customer sat in their establishment without purchasing. I was floored! On top of the harassment, I'm now part of a conspiracy with a stranger I've never met to waste your resources? She then said: "Birds of a feather, flock together!" My brain could not believe what I was hearing. I would say the staff member did thank me for some reason but I felt it was a contrived effort to deescalate the situation before it became worst. In conclusion, as a fellow business-owner I empathize with the daily struggles it takes to run a business and when you encounter a potential customer who may appear to be taking advantage of your gratitude it may feel like a slap in the face. I get it. However, I live one block away, have frequented the business numerous times and was treated like total trash today. I wasn't a bum looking to rudely hassle the other customers for money. I was clearly a busy customer who thought a neighborhood coffee shop such as Robust would be a "friendly" place to support and work at for an hour. Clearly Robust has become a product of an environment I thought was long forgotten in the Woodlawn Community even with the surrounding crime/violence. It has in its time active here in our neighborhood turned into a rude place that I will NEVER recommend to be visited to my friends and family for the foreseeable future. I will be mentioning this to my Alderman as well being I live across the street from him. We should not condone this sort of treatment in our community.BE WARNED: "No Trust in Robust!" (Unless you buy something.)

8.description: This place beats the pants out of Starbucks.  Staff is very friendly and the decor is old school with industrial qualities. I would definitely suggest having a taste of the honey nut latte. This drink is an amazing warm, smooth, and just the right amount of love in a cup  to brighten any day.

31.description: Robust is my goto spot when I want a change of scenery from my home office. There's always something good to eat (and good for me) but then there's also those pastries they bring in from Brown Sugar Bakery that always tempt me to indulge. The space is well designed and there's plenty of room to socialize or get stuff done. The staff is fast and friendly. The location is perfect. It's a community hub so there's always a circle of folks chatting about big ideas and having meetings there, so it's not a bad place to network either. I highly recommend Robust!

34.description: I come here a LOT because of its proximity to my workplace--sometimes on the clock and sometimes not, depending. In the 25 or so times that I've been to Robust, I've tried a LOT of the menu and I have also had a lot of different interactions with different staff. I have not had a particularly consistent experience here, which is why I have held off on a review. I've had some five-star customer service experiences and some two-star customer dr vide experiences. I've had some five-star food and some two-star food. I'm going to focus instead on my overall experience, including the sum of 25 visits to Robust. Overall, Robust is an excellent addition to the Woodlawn community. It's located conveniently right on the corner and it's a meeting place for lifelong residents of the community, as well as University of Chicago staff and students who want to venture a little off the beaten path off campus. Uniform-clad school children can frequently be found here enjoying a snack or beverage after school hours. The diversity of customers at Robust is great and adds to the welcoming atmosphere.The service can be hit or miss. Some of the staff are incredibly kind, patient, and friendly, while others are fairly negligent and inattenive. My orders are messed up maybe 35% of the time, which is not the best. I have had my order forgotten more than a few times. Sometimes, the staff are really apologetic and offer to give me extra flavor or a bigger size to compensate. Sometimes, they barely bat an eyelash. I've tried maybe half of the menu items, including blended drinks like the oreo madness, smoothies like the almond milk, banana, chai, food items like the grilled cheese and hummus platter, the mocha diablo, pumpkin spice latte, gingerbread latte, etc. So, why the four-star rating? At the end of the day, I know I can count on Robust to be a cozy haven--a true gem in Woodlawn. Robust has a great atmosphere, acceptable drinks/food/prices, and (most importantly, for me) seating, outlets, and wifi. Seriously, I have never not been able to find a seat or outlet here and that is the most important thing! I will continue to be a happy customer at Robust as long as I work in Woodlawn.

16.description: For someone who studies so close, it's a shame that I hadn't visited Robust more often. This cafe is thankfully relatively not crowded and mostly devoid of students so it's a lovely escape from academia. It's a relatively small place but that adds to it's charm. Numerous tables near outlets and free wifi make this an excellent place to do work beyond the confines of a library. It's a lot quieter than a Starbucks, even with music playing, Their coffee is excellent and decently priced. But lemme tell you about their Rueben: A+. Just the right amount of corned need and cabbage. So delicious. I'm actually sad that I have been living so long without it. If you're in the area, come on by. You won't regret it.

13.description: A very solid neighborhood coffee shop with friendly staff and tasty food. Good prices all the way around. I'm definitely sad that I don't live around the corner from them anymore. My only issue is that they are fairly slow with getting food out, which isn't great if you're on your way to work. They also don't use the highest quality ingredients in their breakfast items--very processed mixes, etc. But their sandwiches are great and reasonably priced.

11.description: Great place for studying. Lots of room and everyone is super nice. Their mocha is amazing. Plus, the breakfast sandwich I ordered was made fresh. It was so good! My friend didn't love the mocha because she said it was too sweet, but I think a little sweetness it deserved with chocolate. She did love the apple donut though! I can't wait to return!

39.description: Original Review was 2 StarsWhen we first started to come here, this place was pretty cool. It is a quick walk from our apartment and nice to go to. The coffee and coffee based drinks are pretty good. However, the problem comes with the food. First off, it is kind of expensive for what you get. Secondly, they take a horribly long time to do fairly simple tasks. Thirdly, they tend to lose the food tickets a lot. When that happens, they aren't very apologetic and kind of look at you like you're trying to scam them (although they gave you a number for your food and it is still sitting on your table). Most of the staff has changed since we first started coming here and I feel like the service went down when that happened. I would like to still come here since it is close to home and I'd hate for the business to leave since it is one of the few places like this. However, just because it doesn't have any competition doesn't mean that their customer service should suck.10/3/15In the past year or so, Robust has really changed and become a lot better.  It still takes awhile to get food sometimes, but the staff actually being pleasant makes the whole place seem a lot better.

37.description: I used to really love going to this place...my last three visits they gave me the wrong order after waiting for 15 minutes and then I had to wait another 15 minutes to get my order right. Needless to say, my hot chocolate or should I say hot milk got cold. I used to love their hot chocolate, but now they add a drop of chocolate sauce for any size and all I have is a cup of milk. I have to go out of my way to get to this place and I am disappointed. The plain bagels with cream cheese are still good, but this will be my last time going there...

0.description: The staff is personable and they gladly accommodate my culinary eccentricities such as the everything bagel with a hard fried egg, lettuce, onion and tomato with light basil cream cheese.  The "half-priced-after 5," freshly-made smoothies are a delight.  As they expand their offerings and space, they have assured me that they shall even better accommodate vegetarians.  We shall see.  In the meantime, I shall order my usual.

38.description: I am a Youth Readiness Mentor, and in mid-July, my mentees and I decided to meet at Robust for our regular weekly meeting. After purchasing a drink from the counter and waiting for my mentees to arrive, I realized that the employees were stealing disapproving glances at our table far too frequently. They peeked around the corner and walked away whispering among themselves and made me so uncomfortable that I gathered my mentees and left. I can't, after all, successfully teach job readiness in a place where disapproval and discriminatory behavior is so blatant. I don't know if the problem was that we went on a Sunday, or if it was that the young men in my group had on jeans. At any rate, there is wi-fi and coffee all over the city. This is one place we SHAN'T visit again.

51.description: Recently got a cold-brewed ice coffee from them. They are usually delicious, but this time my coffee tasted like old fish. It turns out there was a lot of mold at the bottom of my coffee -- yikes! I returned the coffee (the clerk just said "ew" -- not even a "Sorry about that") and got a hot coffee poured over ice.

27.description: Quirky, independent local establishment that is great for coming with friends for unique breakfast combinations. Whenever I'm in Chicago my friends and I come here after Mass. Try the bacon waffles!

32.description: Me and my boyfriend have been coming to this establishment for four months now and progressively worse. Originally we fell in love with Robust (63rd & Woodlawn), but as time went on, the food was made with less care, brought out incorrect according to the receipt (twice), cold, and as of today, a 25 minute wait. What took the cake was what my boyfriend found in his sandwich, a rogue piece of paper. It seems as if it is a piece of deli or packing paper. That can happen to anyone, I understand. It's just  the staff THIS DAY was unapologetic. I'll probably stop by for a quick cup of coffee, but for food, that's a whole different story. Side note:During the other mishaps the staff was quick to correct the problem. Now, they seem unmotivated or even worse, disinterested in pleasing the customer.

54.description: I live on the Northside, when I started working in the Woodlawn/Englewood area I needed a getaway from the office and a place to catch a breath.  Just coming across the building I tried a sandwich and coffee back in the summer, been going ever since.  Price is right, their selection is pretty wide, having  lots of choices for sandwiches and brunch/lunch options.  Oh and the coffee is on POINT.

48.description: Quite a nice place - the atmosphere is humming but not noisy, which is the kind of ambiance I like when I'm doing work.I tried the BBQ Lou and the Herbie. The former was a winner - brisket was delicious and the coleslaw and bun were the perfect accompaniment. Bonus: they give you little Tootsie Rolls/Pops with your meal!The Herbie, on the other hand, wasn't my favorite - the sandwich was basically a HUGE scoop of (really bland) chicken salad with some lettuce and bacon. The pumpernickel bread it came on was pretty good, but I wouldn't recommend the sandwich as a whole.I also had a chai latte, which was nice if a little on the bland side as well. While the flavor of the chai was good, it felt like the chai to milk ratio was a little low. I still enjoyed it enough that I would order it again, though.Boyfriend had two of the smoothies: the Hawaiian Dream and the Sunrise. I snuck a little of each - the former was my favorite of the two.Overall, definitely worth the trip, and a nice place to get some studying done.

44.description: I loved the ambiance! They have books! They have Yummy hot fresh fast breakfast sandwiches. I had an egg and cheese on a biscuit and a ginger peach tea. Yum. I didn't want to leave. The staff is nice too.

24.description: Solid place, competes with all of the great coffee shops on the North Side without the inconvenience of parking/crowds AND without the price tag. You can get a sandwich and a coffee for about $5 here.

7.description: Hands down one of the best coffee shops in the city, right up there with Dollop. The coffee is great, the food smells delicious, though I've yet to taste any of the cuisine. The atmosphere is very trendy, but manages to still feel very south side. There are plenty of outlets and seats, although the few times I went, the available seating was limited to the area by the door, because the lounge area was pretty packed.  When I was growing up down the street, I would never have imagined a place this cool and diverse venturing outside of the Hyde Park/ U of C area, but I'm glad they did.

49.description: I'm not saying they have the best food ever -- indeed, the sandwiches are a little simple and a little bland -- but there is something so delightfully *earnest* about this place.  The space is bright, lively, and welcoming; the service is friendly; they make their own soup.  And in it is in a little corner of South Hyde Park that desperately needs something welcoming and earnest.  I've lived in Chicago for less than two months and I've already been here three times.

40.description: When this place first opened it was the best. High quality and great service. It really has gone down in quality and the service is really lacking now. The fresh squeezed lemonade often tastes too bitter, their pineapple green tea is too acidic, the croissants are now just heavy buns, donuts are hard and dry on several occasions. Went to get a English muffin there the other day and asked for it toasted, it came out rubbery and soft. Sent it back twice And then just gave up, threw it out and went elsewhere. My brothers went there the other day and even their specialty sandwich, BBQ Betty, was dry and not delicious anymore. I'm sad. Really loved this place for the first year or two. Not worth it anymore.

53.description: Best coffee shop on the Southside. No context. This is one of my favorite places in Chicago

30.description: Great service great drinks and food I just wish they ordered more inventory and kept their stock up they are always out of my two favorite drinks cake batter and vanilla bean mix

46.description: For someone who studies so close, it's a shame that I hadn't visited Robust more often. This cafe is thankfully relatively not crowded and mostly devoid of students so it's a lovely escape from academia. It's a relatively small place but that adds to it's charm. Numerous tables near outlets and free wifi make this an excellent place to do work beyond the confines of a library. It's a lot quieter than a Starbucks, even with music playing, Their coffee is excellent and decently priced. But lemme tell you about their Rueben: A+. Just the right amount of corned need and cabbage. So delicious. I'm actually sad that I have been living so long without it. If you're in the area, come on by. You won't regret it.

1.description: The Good:- the people behind the counter are fantastic and friendly. Love them all!- great brand of coffee. - cool atmosphere- good location- comfortable- non-dairy milks available- nice selection of baked goods from a local bakery- coffee by-the-pound that they will grind for you- nice selection of smoothies- homemade "diablo" syrup is a sweet and spicy coffee flavour they make in house for the Mocha Diablo. - usually quiet,  FREE WIFI! Great to get some work done.- Kid friendly, with a book shelf for reading in your down timeThe Bad:- non-dairy milks are all sweetened, which makes any fancy non-dairy latte TOO sweet after the flavouring is added.- a lot of the food is low quality pre-made mixes and packaged products (pancakes aren't fresh made batter, hummus is pre-packaged, the "cheese" is orange american style single slices,  breakfast condiments are just Smucker's jams and pancake syrupetc. Skip the food.)- blended cold drinks are made with a packet of pre-mixed artificially flavoured powders (YUCK. Just skip these entirely)- flavoured coffee syrups are cheap, teeth shatteringly sweet and give your latte a chemical taste. Avoid the flavored coffees (with the exception of the homemade Diablo syrup).I want to love Robust, but I can't give 5 stars because they are lacking in quality and attention to detail. I'll keep going back though, because small local business support is important, and they're still miles better than DD or Starbucks!

55.description: Some of the best coffee in the area. I love the atmosphere, there are many tables and outlets, so it is a good place to work or study. They also have terrific smoothies.

9.description: Nice little coffee spot but I wasn't a fan of the London Fog. Honestly just tasted like warm milk and tea... Their sandwiches look really great though.

26.description: WORST COFFEE SHOP EVER, I wish I could give them negative stars..there was only one person ahead of me and We both had to wait ten minutes for someone to acknowledge us...I then had to wait another ten minutes in line once my order was taken.  After  waiting patiently for ten min. I  asked to speak to the manager for a refund for the long wait and he told me that I was impatient and needed to wait and would not give me a refund. I believe his name was jake or Jeff , white guy (slim) brown hair with glasses...he then proceeded to make other drinks for  for people who ordered after me. Then he asked me what did I order . Also, there was no where to sit because the place is crowded with teenagers  who don't buy anything.bottom line is go to Starbucks and not patronize this neighborhood business...this place deserves no stars and the employees at Starbucks acknowledge their customers!!!!!!

25.description: I've been an avid fan of Robust for years now. The drinks are cheap (or at least cheaper than Starbucks) and I've never had a problem with my order. The sandwiches are great - my go to's are the sausage biscuit and the BBQ Betty. They run a variety of promotions ($5 sandwiches after a certain time, half price coffee at certain times) so check their fb page before you drop by.

12.description: Nice place! Had the BBQ Betty. It was suppose to be on a pretzel bun, they were out of them so I was offered an onion roll. I must say it was tasty but every bite I wished I had that pretzel bun.  Also Got a piece of Carmel cake that was huge, tasted average and was $5, ugh. Seems like a great place to escape and get some work done, or  study. Nothing else really around it in walking distance.

59.description: There is nothing like Robust around in this neighborhood, so it fills a need in the community.  Because it is a little out of the way, there are always tables and parking spots available.  Has free wi-fi, but not a lot of outlets.  The music is a little loud and nearby conversations talk over the music, so depending on your study habits, it might be a hard place to get work done.The coffee is good and the prices are reasonable, especially when compared to other coffee shops. The best deal is the medium coffee and donut fo $2.  Perfect for my tastes and student budget.

21.description: I tried their "special" biscuits with sausage gravy but unfortunately, it was far from special. Unless all that paprika they sprinkled on top was suppose to make it special and not taste like paprika. The biscuits were good and were the highlight. The gravy barely had any sausage in it. The staff and atmosphere were just ok.

17.description: Nice small place to get some coffee and baked goods. Their sandwiches aren't bad either! Definitely worth a try.

10.description: Looks like it could be a nice place but I wasn't pleased with the service....or lack thereof. We walked in to get drinks and ice cream and when I saw the menu I told my kids maybe we'd come in one day for breakfast. We stood at the counter and there was a girl making a drink. Her hair was awesome but she glanced at us and said nothing. We stood around.  A guy came from the back and made eye contact, but said nothing. We stood around. The girl came over and stood there silently. No, "hello, may I help you?" Nothing. My son wants to know if they have ice cream. "Floats." He asks again. I try to explain that from her response I assume they only have vanilla ice cream and some sort of flavors of soda. She remains silent. He asks if they have cookies and cream. She shakes her head. Ok, he'll take a cookie. I ask what the shaken lemonade is. It's lemonade with flavors. Ok. We order a lemonade.  I ask how much the boxed water is (because it's fancy and people like to charge ridiculous prices for fancy stuff) She doesn't answer. Ok. "So you want a cookie, a lemonade and a boxed water?" No, I wanted to know how much the water is. $2. No thanks. She fresh squeezed (awesome!) the lemonade for my daughter and hands it to me. We walk out and my daughter spits the lemonade out. It's bitter. Unsweetened. Why not mention that? We go back in for sugar.  Maybe I asked too many questions. Maybe I wanted more because I'd just run 3 miles or maybe it was because I kept seeing this place and saying I was going to stop in. Whatever it was, I wasn't pleased with the service.  I've had a bad week dealing with UPS and Comcast, I want a smile and a hello at the local coffee shop, I guess.

5.description: Despite having lived within walking distance to Robust for the past year, I never made the short trek there to try it out before now. What a mistake! This spot has delicious food, plenty of seating, and fantastic music playing to liven up the atmosphere. This is a very sunny spot that is perfect for grabbing lunch with a friend or for studying. They have a great selection of sandwiches for lunch- I had the roast beef, which came on an onion roll and was very tasty! I can't wait to come back here again and try out the many yummy-looking pastries and cakes they have on display!

3.description: I have always been wondering if there was any good coffee shop around the University of Chicago.  Back in January this year, my Yelp Elite friends, Eva. S and Jen B. (Hi, girls) showed me this Indie coffee shop passport.  Robust Coffee Lounge in Woodlawn was on the list.  I finally made it here with Daddy J.  RCL technically isn't "on" campus, but it's south of UC border on the southwest corner of Woodlawn and 63rd.  Their coffee is reasonably-priced.  For $8 and some change, we had a large, bold, and wake-me-up Americano and a large, mildly-spiced, calm-me-down Diablo mocha.  I actually like this place a lot for these following reasons:1) free working wifi2) bright lighting through large windows3) plenty of seating for solo and group travelers4) friendly service 5) good selections of books, magazines, and newspapers They accept major credit cards (not sure about the minimum purchase).  It's also accessible via #63 bus (with a seasonal service east to the 63rd. St. Beach).Ok, now I'm done with the review.  It's time for me to space out at RCL...

35.description: I like the sandwiches. I like the coffee. I like the ambiance. I don't like the half ass, unbothered demeanor of some of the staff. P.S. Don't ask to get your sandwich cut after they send it out. You will be directed to the plastic knives near the condiment stand. Yes, I know I'm being petty. But it's the principle!

19.description: Quirky, independent local establishment that is great for coming with friends for unique breakfast combinations. Whenever I'm in Chicago my friends and I come here after Mass. Try the bacon waffles!

28.description: The service here sucks! I've popped in a few times and almost always made to feel like an inconvenience. Don't expect a "hello", "good morning ", a smile or even eye contact, it more than likely won't happen here. This morning I needed coffee and stopped by...I noticed flies in the donut/danish glass area...I left. The one star is for the pleasant afternoon staff...

45.description: Let's see..I loved the little atmosphere it had, not bland at all. Smelled like coffee and eggs! I loved that part.I decided to make my own sandwich. I made a croissant sausage, egg, and cheese sandwich. The sad part that made this place lose points was that the bread was very dry.The coffee? Now that was good. Good strong roast with some caramel I added.

33.description: I didn't really like my experience here. That being said, I won't give Robust a low rating because I recognize there wasn't much the staff could have done to make it better. I was here in the afternoon, about 3PM, and the café was absolutely overrun with loud, rowdy schoolchildren. The staff tried to quiet them down, but to no avail. I held out hope that maybe there was a special back room into which the children would be ushered and locked into, but no dice. The kids stopped coming in at around 5, although the noise level remained somewhat loud, as many people seem to use this café as a meeting/tutoring space. If not for the kids, this would be a cool place. I had the honey nut latte, which is made with almond milk, and is really tasty. I like that there's a variety of seating and a selection of books/magazines. The service was kind of surly, but I probably wouldn't be too friendly either if I had to deal with those kids for 2 hours. They have a huge sandwich list, but the prices were high. I would not make a special trip to Robust, but if you're in the area, it makes a nice hang-out spot. Just make sure to avoid between 3-5PM on weekdays.

43.description: They aight. Fecking expensive though; they take their geographic monopoly deadly serious. The menu is on the wall, and what's there is it; this place is not terribly veg-friendly. It's a decent place to sit, sip and snack, and there's a take one/leave one library there as well. Robust is nothing to crow about, but it will serve if you're in this no-mans land of food options and need something to satisfy.

2.description: Once, a long time ago and in a suburb far, far away, I accidentally put in about a teaspoon of honey in my newly-purchased dark roast coffee. I chalked this up to an "oops" and quickly grabbed the simple syrup bottle instead.So when Robust Coffee Lounge comes along and intentionally sells me a "honey nut latte", you've caught my attention. And I wasn't sure if it was in a good way, or a bad way.Short answer: in a good way. The honey and rich coffee work together really well, actually, with the flavors complementing each other and not conflicting. The "nut" part of the drink (probably almond syrup) was a nice touch, and I think that was what made the whole thing quite sweet. It's an excellent iced coffee, with a rich sweetness. And it was perfect for a post-run drink. It's a nice place to hang out in, to boot. Woodlawn has a fine coffee shop in its borders.

18.description: I've been an avid fan of Robust for years now. The drinks are cheap (or at least cheaper than Starbucks) and I've never had a problem with my order. The sandwiches are great - my go to's are the sausage biscuit and the BBQ Betty. They run a variety of promotions ($5 sandwiches after a certain time, half price coffee at certain times) so check their fb page before you drop by.

41.description: This is my sister and I go to spot for tea/ coffee and catching up. We usually walk over since I live 3 blocks away. Great coffee drinks, yesterday I had a regular grilled cheese and tomato sandwich which was good. The service is good although I've heard of others having a bad experience here. I think its a great neighborhood joint that deserves the good reviews it has earned.

52.description: One of those really happy surprises... when you end up in a neighborhood you've never been in before at 8:30am on a Saturday morning with just enough time for coffee, and yelp informs you that there's a non-Starbucks coffee shop nearby.  The only thing I was really bummed about was that I had to grab and go; the space inside was great and I could definitely see myself sitting in there for an hour or a few at a time.  I had an iced latte which was totally solid, and this ridiculous donut which kept me powered up all through my morning.  Three cheers for independent coffee shops kicking ass!  Especially at 63rd and woodlawn!

50.description: Literally my absolute favorite place to go get work done. I work from home most of the year and love coming here to get out of the house. They have killer service, great coffee, really good sandwiches. They don't make their own pastries, but they're good (nothing to write home about). They also always have a good set of music playing. My hubby is a med student at UChicago and it's convenient but out of the way enough that it's not crowded. Free internet is a huge plus too!!

4.description: I meet the owners when they were building this cafe. I knew then it would bring new life into a neighborhood with very few social spots to hand out. Robust is a great place to meet with friends and family or to do a quick meeting. They since than have opened a new lounge on 416 W Ontario St. They both are the perfect mix of great coffee, social atmosphere and goooood food. :)

6.description: I come here a LOT because of its proximity to my workplace--sometimes on the clock and sometimes not, depending. In the 25 or so times that I've been to Robust, I've tried a LOT of the menu and I have also had a lot of different interactions with different staff. I have not had a particularly consistent experience here, which is why I have held off on a review. I've had some five-star customer service experiences and some two-star customer dr vide experiences. I've had some five-star food and some two-star food. I'm going to focus instead on my overall experience, including the sum of 25 visits to Robust. Overall, Robust is an excellent addition to the Woodlawn community. It's located conveniently right on the corner and it's a meeting place for lifelong residents of the community, as well as University of Chicago staff and students who want to venture a little off the beaten path off campus. Uniform-clad school children can frequently be found here enjoying a snack or beverage after school hours. The diversity of customers at Robust is great and adds to the welcoming atmosphere.The service can be hit or miss. Some of the staff are incredibly kind, patient, and friendly, while others are fairly negligent and inattenive. My orders are messed up maybe 35% of the time, which is not the best. I have had my order forgotten more than a few times. Sometimes, the staff are really apologetic and offer to give me extra flavor or a bigger size to compensate. Sometimes, they barely bat an eyelash. I've tried maybe half of the menu items, including blended drinks like the oreo madness, smoothies like the almond milk, banana, chai, food items like the grilled cheese and hummus platter, the mocha diablo, pumpkin spice latte, gingerbread latte, etc. So, why the four-star rating? At the end of the day, I know I can count on Robust to be a cozy haven--a true gem in Woodlawn. Robust has a great atmosphere, acceptable drinks/food/prices, and (most importantly, for me) seating, outlets, and wifi. Seriously, I have never not been able to find a seat or outlet here and that is the most important thing! I will continue to be a happy customer at Robust as long as I work in Woodlawn.

22.description: Nice small place to get some coffee and baked goods. Their sandwiches aren't bad either! Definitely worth a try.

15.description: Great stop for quick coffee an sandwich I will be a frequent customer sandwich was fresh an coffee was good on top of all of that great setting

57.description: Such a lovely addition to the neighborhood! Now that I live in North Hyde Park, I no longer have as many opportunities to stop by, but whenever I do, I am not disappointed! The café is always buzzing with a refreshing mix of high schoolers from the neighborhood and U of C students. Their iced chai cannot be beat -- I have tried to get a peek at their brand of concentrate and have never been able to figure out which kind they use, but it's absolutely to die for. I also recommend their offerings from the Brown Sugar Bakery - yum!

20.description: I've been to Robust in Woodlawn a few times when visiting my sister at University of Chicago. While the food can be a bit inconsistent at times, overall I've left really satisfied. Coffee is fantastic. Vibes are egalitarian and academic. I'd say this is one of the few places in and around U Chicago that local residents and students genuinely interact. Staff has always been very friendly and accommodating.

36.description: Absolutely the best of everything; atmosphere, customer service, food and last but not least, coffee... which just happens to be superbly 'Robust'.

14.description: Everything here is good and made the way I like my food to taste! The grits aren't bland, the sandwiches are well balanced and the smoothies are delicious. The service is cool, I mean you don't feel like you are a part of the family lol but the prices are so reasonable for the great quality!Also, the wifi is strong so it is a great place to work or study.

1.description: The management in this establishment needs to be trained with communication and interpersonal skills.  I have just learned of an incident in which someone I know was wrongfully accused and threatened for shoplifting and after realizing it was all a mistake...  no apology or any type of attempt to rectify the situation.  I will no longer support this produce market.

0.description: Big market with all the basics and more.Good prices and ok services. Need to have more cashiers open, they usually have only 2 for a store this size they need more.Some good prices as wellOverall not the first choice but bad either
This is the only place I will go and get my  tattoos from. The prices are very good and ac is very good . Im currently have 13 tattoos and skin passion have done them all and going back for more

My family and I visited this store this past Saturday in the hopes of buying a bed and a dresser for our pre-teen daughter. We were able to get a very nice bed and matching dresser for a very reasonable price. We placed the order to be delivered the upcoming Monday, but the saleslady called and said that she would be able to have the furniture delivered that same day (Saturday). We were very happy to hear that we wouldn't have to wait for our furniture. The furniture was actually delivered 30 minutes earlier than I expected (no complaints here!). The saleslady came with the delivery guy and she instructed him where to place the furniture (he even set up the bed for us). The saleslady was nice enough to take a look at my bedroom to help me figure out what size furniture I needed, and where I would be able to put it, as I needed furniture as well but hadn't due to not knowing the size. The saleslady was very pleasant and so was the delivery guy. He set everything up so fast, I had no idea he was done until the saleslady told me he was done. I will most definitely be purchasing more furniture in the future from this store.

1.description: Papa Ts forgot my slice of pizza.  I called back and told the lady that answered and for 30 seconds dead air. I said hello?  She said please hold like I was bothering her. A gentleman picked up and said we will get the slice right out. I asked him to please make sure it's not cold like the rest of the food he told me it shouldn't be cold. He did offer to remake the order I told him no thanks.  Not one time did anyone apologize. Customer service in the toilet!So I called back and the manager was even more rude!  Please do not order from Papa Ts.   Places like this should not be in business!!!!

9.description: Haven't ordered pizza here in a while. And when we finally did today it's took two hours and the pizza was cold and fries even colder.

12.description: The food is mediocre, and takes forever for delivery, but it's a last resort for ordering out in this area. I just called to place an order, and the person who took my order was a total b$@*h! She was beyond disrespectful, and didn't handle the call professionally. I'm not patronizing this business any longer, neither should you!

21.description: I am in complete agreement with Erin.  If you have a car there are far better choices in the area for both pizza and ribs.  However, in a pinch (i.e. you don't want to or can't or are just to lazy to drive to a better pizza place) it will cure your pizza fix.  There have been a few occasions, however, when the delivery has come after 2 hours of call backs, or hasn't come at all.  It is because of this that I rarely order from here.

16.description: If you ever want to be treated like garbage, call and order from this papa t's. They are rude and down right disrespectful. On day I requested to speak to a manger, the man was so ghetto fabulous. He talked over me he was even ruder than the young lady that placed my order! Ugh no stars...get it together folks

17.description: Sometimes the pizza is hot, sometimes it looks like its been sitting around all day. It makes feeding a group pretty inexpensive though.

10.description: First, the person who took my order got my order wrong which was probably good because I ordered three and only got two pizzas and the pizza was horrible. Worst pizza I've had in years! Do not order from here, especially over the phone. Had to call four times for someone to answer.

5.description: Papa T's was 2 minutes shy of a  2 hour delivery.  When I called  to cancel the order, they would put me  on hold or would hang up.  The "hickory smoked" wings are actually deep fried with BBq sause.  The food was so cold that I had to reheat ALL OF IT. STOMACH ACHE FOOD. I NEVER THOUGHT I WOULD WRITE SUCH A BAD REVIEW. FIRST TIME EVER.

11.description: I don't know why it took me this long to write a review on them, but here it goes. Their Pizza is meh -at best. On a scale of 1-10 I give their pizza about a 6. But the BiGGEST bummer has to be the ridiculous credit card policy. I had a bill totaling $14.00 and some change and I couldn't pay with my credit card because their cashier told me (with an attitude) there was a $15.00 limit on credit card transactions. Are they serious? This happened about 5 years ago and I refused to pay because I had no cash--and to this day, I'm still on their system as a 'bad' non paying customer who canceled the order. Shame on them.

22.description: I've been living in the area near Papa T's for 7 years and maybe it's me but the quality of their food has really gone down.  Besides pizza, they also serve barbeque (which I'm really picky about) and I don't even bother to order that anymore because the sauce isn't good and it's not barbequed it's baked and if I want oven baked barbeque I can do that at home!  The pizza is ok, just ok.  And you must eat it hot, it's not the best pizza cold because it tastes like salt and bread.Edit: had their thick crust supreme over the weekend...my new fave.  Yum-O!!

0.description: In all the MANY years my family and I have patronized Papa T's, I must say that the quality of service AND pizza have fallen off.Yesterday, I called and ordered pizzas for pickup. The phone order taker was fine. When I got to the place to get my food, the broad (bitch!) behind the counter had a stank attitude. Then when I got home and took a bite of pizza, something was a bit off. The sauce was thick with a weird taste, and I noticed that the crust ("thin" crust) was a bit thicker than I'm used to. *Note to Papa T's:  Go back to using the pizza recipe you used a few years ago. The crust AND sauce used was way better than what I had yesterday.... and get people behind the counter that actually LIKE to do their job!!!!

20.description: .......My food is cold.  Everytime they deliver. I don't think they realize that you can't put hot food in the same bag w/ your salad. Their pizza is bland. I don't really like it but my kids will eat it if they have a taste for pizza when we are suddenly getting broke. Nice prices, bad food.  Ladies over the phone attitude is fartted up and the long wait for the delivery is bent over. Believe me, I won't lie to you. Gotta taste for screwed up service, call 436-2100. They are open till 11 weekdays.

19.description: Whats worse than cold bland pizza? Having to wait a hr for delivery and then reheating it yourself this pizza is awwwwffffffullllllll. NEVER AGAIN! If I had a choice of giving them zero stars I would but blah whatever they don't even deserve the title of saying this is pizza.

2.description: Great Pizza!!!Horrible attitude!!!! They need to hire better people!! We like the pizza, great flavor but truly hate dealing with the girls that answer the phone!!! Disgusting attitude!

18.description: I WISH I had read all these review first!!!  This place is HORRIBLE and the service even worse!  The managers, I dont even know where to start.  First of all, the male manager was extremely RUDE putting the phone down while he complained to all his staff about me complaining about one of his drivers.  THEN the female manager a tad nicer but not helpful.  Long story short, I never received my delivery, they claimed their driver was chased down by gangbangers with a GUN all the way for 2 blocks..............my father and neighbor had been outside outfront and NEVER saw any type of gang activity on my block during the whole time.  If this place doesnt want our business, then I DEFINITELY dont want to give it to them.  But I sure do hope they STOP HANGING THEIR LOUSY FLYERS ON MY DOOR KNOBS!!!!  Will never call on this place!  EVER!!!!

13.description: If I could I would give this place negative stars!!! The phone girls have the worst and unprofessional I have ever encounter! !! First please make sure you that phone girls know your menu and what each coupon is!! It takes one about 1 1/2 to 2 hours for your order!!! Usually comes cold they charge you for parmesan cheese and crushed red pepper and dont even send it!! Delivery drivers don't even come to door call you to come outside to their car to get your order!! I can deal with waiting but the poor unprofessional attitudes these phone girls have I will NEVER order from here again will make it a point to let family and friends know this so they never order from here again either!!!

4.description: The pizza is good bit i have to share be careful with how they charge you. They change the prices when you place an order. The menu Is deceiving the prices are changed when you place the order by phone, also when you pay with your card by phone they charge you an additional $1.00. In addition delivery says $3 or $4 dollars depending on the distance well....my friend lives 2 blocks away and with his disability he is charged the $4. Really? So it's a flat delivery of $4. Never $3? Shady if you tell me. Not sure about this place anymore..

6.description: literally I am pissed off I just called 5 minutes ago and the customer service is horrible! the lady that works there she is so rude and ghetto she does not deserve a job at all because she doesn't know how to speak to people! I will never be ordering from this ghetto pizza restaurant again! Word of advice to the owners be careful who you hire because it's messing with business.

15.description: This place used to have good pizza now it sucks. Delivery is horrible too, it took them 1:30 mins to deliver my cold pizza. Never ordering again. It's probably run by morons.

7.description: This review is delivery only.. I have ordered here for years.  But not only was the service slow the product was horrible.  Cold , thicker crust pizza ( ordered thin crust).  Called the restaurant after an 1 hour and 30 minutes, had to wait 10 minutes for a live person while simply checking the staus of my order.. the young lady could only give the answer its with the driver.  No estimation on time.  Papa t's you have lost a customer...I will save my 20 bucks and just drive to nearest grocery store to buy a pizza.

8.description: I placed an order for there 2 large special from a coupon on a menu that I had. I've always ordered with them as my family enjoys the pizza. The customer service can be better but I deal with it because of the love for pizza and a company that does it right. I placed an order 2/9/15 @ 7:27, and the person that I spoke with was fine with taking my order and told me that it would arrive within an hour. I said great because the girls go to bed at 9pm. I call back 15mins before 9pm and I said I placed an order at 7:30, and my food isn't here she replied it's left the building ok, and hung up. I called back at 9:05 and asked to speak with a manager because of the previous rude person and my food still wasn't here. I spoke to Stacy, and if she is the manager I totally understand the attitude. The team are only as good as the person that supervises them. I was eventually placed on hold for over 5mins while she reached the driver, she came back and said that he was running late and would arrive within 5 mins I can go outside. He arrived at 9:25 with 2 cold a** pizzas, and I told him I didn't want a pizza that I had to reheat. He went back and forth with me as to why I couldn't open the box because he couldn't resale them. I told him that was okay because I can feel the bottom of this sausage and it's not warm at all. He said he has an order before me, I said I sure hope at least they had hot pizza. Then he opens the box to let me see it, I said look at that pepperoni pizza it's cold. I said let me let you out the building and I opened the door a young lady was walking pass and she said what pizza place is this that delivers over here (he told her and asked her if she likes pepperoni). She said yes but I'm not ordering, and he said I can sale it to you for a good price. They started talking and I waked away. When I got back in to look out the window she was buying the pepperoni pizza. He just told me that he couldn't open the box due to resale, but he opened it anyway and tail sold the pizza. Now a days I don't expect customer service to be 100, but I would appreciate effort, and courtesy when I'm paying my money. Again I like the pizza, just not the customer service. I called back to let them know I didn't take the pizza and asked who is the manager in the morning they said Leo. I will reach out to him tomorrow. Now I'm hungry, tired, and unsatisfied!!! Tcs

3.description: They actually have pretty good pizza one time the delivery guy was rude but it wasn't worth not ordering again...I like the sauce and how the thin crust isn't too thin or hard it's really tasty and they have great coupon deals...just give it a try you'll be suprised

14.description: I've lived in this area for 30yrs and Papa T's service has gone to the pits! The customer service sucks, the quality of pizza is horrible!! I'm not sure if the ownership changed but when I first ordered from them you couldn't get enough of their pizza but now I wouldn't serve it to my dog, one thine they had the nerve to sell it burnt... Never again

0.description: Love this place they have so many products that are hard to find I found silicon mix conditioner here for 6 dollars and I was gonna order it on eBay for 13 I buy all my hair products from here and so many hair extension options too and very knowledgeable staff...I frequent this place nothing but good things to say

28.description: I'll start off by saying that I'm a little biased since this place is run by my family.  It hasn't been at this location for 40 years but the place has been around for almost that long in different locations.  They used to be over on Lawndale, I think.  I can't remember, since I was a kid.Anyhow, I absolutely believe they have some of the best pizza out there.  I've yet to find one that tastes as good as they make it.  They also have TONS of other things from sandwiches to pasta to fish and chicken.  If you need it, they've got it and it's all pretty darn tasty.Geneo's was originally owned by my grandparents, Bob and Charlotte.  Then my dad, Bob,  took over several years ago (he's worked there the entire history of the place).  My dad died this last July and the place has been taken over by my grandparents again.  If you're there, say hi to my grandmother.  Everyone calls her Char or Chi (shy).  She's a pistol but a lot of fun!  And ask for some garlic bread with cheese "Jennifer style".  She'll load it up with garlic butter and it's the BEST!

1.description: Wow. Great pizza. Kids wanted pizza and I gave up pork for lent so I order half sausage and half chicken. Chicken pizza was excellent. Fast delivery too.

9.description: Their Pizza is the best! Especially the stuffed pizza. Extremely delicious. Out of all the pizza joints I've gone to, Geneo's is the best one!!

29.description: Geneo's has been here for over 40 years, maybe more. The have the best thin-crust on the south side. The special has everything on it, including bacon and ham. The sauce could be a little more flavorful, but for the value, with all the topping and cheese, it's the best thin crust in Chicago. Take out only.

23.description: Awesomest pizza near MDW. Next time I'm working nearby, I'm getting more. I went to Giordano's on the same trip, and it wasn't nearly as good.I had a deep dish with spinach, tomatoes and chicken. Now deep dish isn't my first choice, but I was with someone from California who had never had Chicago pizza, so there really was no choice. Still, it was pretty awesome. Next time I'll order with extra sauce.For me what makes Chicago pizza so much better than what I get in most other cities is the crust. That nice crunch it has right out of the oven someone how can't reproduced in my hometown Detroit. Unfortunately there is no seating at Geneo's so this means eating in the car, an unwieldy but tasty proposition with a deep dish pizza.

5.description: Delicious pizza if you're willing to wait 2 hours for your order. Ridiculous. Service is horrible. They say it's coming and it isn't. Then they tell you there isn't any supervisor or manager or owner to talk to apparently the kids run the place. Ridiculous service.

25.description: ive been ordering pizza from here ever since we moved into the neighborhood(when you were able to walk the dogs from california to  western at night), then follow it up with renting from royal concept video on 59th n whipple. you can say something like 20+ years. ok the thin crust pizza is some of the best thin crust in chicago, i usually order the sausage with extra sause( the bacon and mushroom topping are also very good). the also sell some of the best texas torpedo's(stuffed jalepenos) breaded zucchini, mushrooms, mozzarella sticks, and the ribs are to die for. i still order from here almost every weekend since i still live in the neighborhood, but if i didnt i would make the trip(the thin crust pizza is that good). all good things aside i really dont care for the stuffed or deep dish pizza here, but again the thin crust is great. so if your ever in the neighborhood, or make the trip, but you wont be able to sit in the place since its only pick up or delivery, so dont come here thinking your going to sit down and eat it in here. that being said call first (773) 925-1631(pizza should be ready in 30 minutes) and dont forget to get the connoli's !!!!

12.description: I'm giving this place 1 star. It used to be 5 in our family but lately it's been bad. We have gotten wrong order 3 times and it seems like they are getting very cheap with their dough and cheese. The last time we ordered (last week) it was super thin and hardly any cheese on it. I felt like I was eating crackers with some cheese on top. It's sad because this was our number 1 pizza place but I'm not sure what happened lately that has changed so much. Maybe new pizza people or new owners??? Who knows, all I know is that it's time to move on and look for a different pizza place.

21.description: The Pizza of my childhood still kicks ass and takes no prisoners and while time may decay us all the pizza remains delicious!!!People I am letting you know right now order a Jumbo Sausage, Mushroom, Pepperoni pizza with some french fries and you will thank me later.Best Pizza in the block obviously  and delicious too.ps. The sausage in the pizza (no homo) is Fantastic!!! best ever!!!!!!!

16.description: The Only reason they only get 4 stars is because they don't have a dining area.... This is by far my go to pizza joint in the neighborhood, Also reasonable priced. It seems to be family owned which is a plus for me, they always give you a 2 liter soda when you order a large pizza.....Delivery and carry out only. If you're in the area definitely check this place out best thin crust in the south side!!

17.description: I've got to give this one five stars.  I cannot count the number of times this placed has saved me from starving while working my job on the south side.  Pizza is delicious, service is good, fast delivery, they usually bring a free bottle of pop for me too!  So I get a large 2 topping delivered, w/ pop for ~ $15.  Highly recommended!!

10.description: Good Pizza.... great Buffalo Wings. Going to continue to order more of their food when I'm in the area.

11.description: I've been eating this pizza for years and it's always been good pizza! But last week I ordered and for the first time in like 17 years they got my order wrong! The drivers always have a bad addituide, in an exception on like a couple of them the lady in charge always had a bad addituide until recently! All in all good pizza, but gonna stick to picking it up from know on And checking it before I leave now!

26.description: I really like the pizza from here.  Introduced to it by a friend of mine, I usually get my pizza from here.  They have found a good balance of sauce, cheese, toppings and crust.  The service is friendly and prompt, with the pizza I ordered ready when they say it will be.

27.description: I read Jenn M.'s review and took it to heart. I have to say,Jenn lied to us. Geneo's is even better than she describes.A longtime staple for our softball team, somehow Geneo's drifted from us as the neighborhood changed and we moved to different parts of the city. I always assumed that is was sold, like most older places were, and then bastardized by the new owners. When I ordered this past week, I was pleasantly delighted.This is the pizza that Chicago was filled with in the 70's and the 80's. Incredible. Great toppings (plenty of choices), excellent crust, and sauce.....yum.If it is possible, it is even better than I remembered. Pizza that is made EXACTLY as you order, decent prices, and great delivery.While it may not be an epiphany, this is certainly a reliable,go-to pizza joint. In my top 3 neighborhood places for sure.

0.description: Surprised I haven't reviewed this place yet, after all is my to go place for pizza in this hoodTo go and only to go place, no tables no waiters, to go only to go.I always call ahead with my order for pick up, usually ready in 30-40 mins., and I don't know about you but that in my book is a good time.Service is always nice and fast, place is run mostly by young people here, kudos to them.Food and prices are good.

20.description: The pizza is ok. They do have good prices and odd hours that are open. It is not a dine in but more like a carry out. Whatever you do...Do not order the Canolis! I did and they were stale and cold.

19.description: Really good pizza.  And reasonably priced.  They always give u a two liter of pop when u get a pizza.   Last time, we ordered two big pizzas and got two two liters.   I got extra two liters on my back porch cuz we don't even drink the pop most times!

2.description: I love this place! It's so yummy. The pizza is delicious I usually get a large for me and my brother and it feeds us just fine, we also get a pop with it. Who wouldn't enjoy a free pop with the purchase of a pizza? When I get together with my friends we order a party pizza and it feeds around 6-7 people but we also get an order of wings as well which I have to say are realllyyyy good. We do have to wait a little for delivery but we have never gotten cold food. It's quicker to just pick it up but it's up to you if you want to get it delivered it might take a while longer or if you want it ASAP then you're better off picking it up.

18.description: Well, I hate to give a bad review but this pizza did not live up to the reviews I read! The thin crust was very doughy and the pizza was dry. No flavor at all except in the sausage... which the sausage was delicious and fresh. I couldn't even taste the cheese because of the crust. I really felt bad for my hubby because he was coming off a fast. He wanted Dominos and I said NO let us get some "real" pizza. Needless to say should've got the Dominos because one thing they have is the buttery garlic flavor. We may try this place again. I just read a tip to order extra thin with extra sauce, that  may work out better for us. The price was reasonable.

13.description: 1 out of 10 I give the pizza a 5 maybe a 6 because fast delivery but other than that the pizza wasn't as great as other people in the reviews mention. The delivery guy also had a bad attitude. I give this pizza place 3 stars.

4.description: I order pizza here all the time. The large looks like medium. So we usually order jumbo. So its big enough. The people who answer the phone are very rude. Now here's the part that messes me up. When I order. Pizza for pick it'll be ready in 30 minutes. But for delivery it takes 2 1/2 hours. For my cold pizza. After 2 hours I always have to call them and say ... Hey where's my pizza?!?! Which the reply it'll be there in 20 minutes which is usually 45. Hate having delivery! The. Cheese sticks are good. But the marinara sauce is not the best. It has huge chunks of ground beef? Would be better with out the meat

24.description: My family and I have been ordering Geneo's since we moved into the neighborhood 16+ years ago. All of our other relatives also order from here. The pizza is great and very innexpensive - I am actually always surprised at how inexpensive it is. We always ask for extra sauce because it appears most pizza joints have been going skimpy with sauce lately. You just can't go wrong with this pizza - great cheese, sauce, and ingredients. OK crust though. I haven't had anything else on the menu other than fries, onion rings, and fried zucchini.

6.description: This place is pretty awesome!! Fast delivery and really great food!! Check out their barbecue chicken pizza, it's my fave!!

22.description: On a much earlier visit I made the mistake of bringing my prejudices with me. First off, I can eat a TON of pizza. If it's great, I can eat a few tons. They have to wheel barrow me out of the best pizza joints, and happily so. Problem was, I was thinking in terms of New Orleans, California, East Coast, etc. and these were geographically and volumetric-ally off by major margins. Order staff looked at me and my diminutive female guest and advised a small. I brushed her off like the rhino to the fly and ordered the large (congratulating myself for the moderation I showed by not ordering the extra large). A large came and I plowed gustily into my first slice, pausing 2/3 through as I realized it was only slice #1 and I was already suffering jaw fatigue. This tore a serious chunk out of my appetite all by itself. Meanwhile, the pizza was great - tasty, piquant, rich, thick, joyous, incredibly filling and so on. I approached slice number two with more caution, but not enough. The last half of slice #2 had more pain than joy and I had to stop eating like it was pizza. Further ingestion was clearly going to be a matter of pacing and pride rather than the ravenous devastation I was used to when the flavor and mood struck.By the time the third slice became a possibility I was sweating like a Saudi Prince and asking myself whether I had (gasp!) made a horrible error in judgment.I had.My twiggy guest had eaten almost half of one slice and I managed only a few bites into #3 before giving up and leaving a good 4 pieces untouched. I'm not sure whether the server's grin was an "I told you so" or a "Good, now we can feed homeless people all over the Midwest for another week" but whatever it was, she was right.Moral of the story: Order with caution

15.description: Love their pizza the only reason they don't get 5  stars is because they take more then 1 hr to Deliver...

7.description: In search of the best non meat pizza during this Lenten season.  Could not find a menu anywhere online for this place.  The only thing I found was a blurry picture that you can't read on yelp.Ordered a half cheese and half green pepper and onion. Found the cheese side to be better tasting then the onion and green pepper.  Not sure if it was because the veggies are out of season here in Chicago.  Definitely will try some of their meat pizzas from here after Lent.

8.description: Good pizza !the lady is most likely always mad because of the area the business is in, and ppl she probably has to deal with ,lol I don't judge as long as the pizza is tasty you'll have my business lady #soupforme !

3.description: This is my favorite pizza joint! I'd give it 5 stars but sometimes when i call to place an order 'Roseanne' picks up! Lol that's not really her name but she's a rude, older woman..Other than that, the best pizza ever!

14.description: FIND ANOTHER PIZZA PLACE! I wanted to put ZERO stars but site wont let me. People answering the phones are ALWAYS VERY RUDE and IGNORANT. It's always about food and service. Used to put up with it because pizza was good but food has been lacking and will not be ordering anymore. Not worth your frustration and money. PLENTY of better pizza places around.

0.description: Great spot to shop in, the owner and wife re very helpful and friendly! They have a big variety and lots of styles to choose from, if your on the south side this is the place to shop for any cowboy outfit and/or boots!

1.description: This Salvation Army Family store is an epitome of an old-fashioned thrift store.  What does that mean?  It means you need to dig in hard!  South side Chicago Salvation Army thrift stores don't really look too appealing stylistically, in comparison to the north side locations.  They also run a different sale and usually don't do the $0.69 color-tag sale on Saturdays.  The south side locations simply run the 50% off color-tag sale.  Thus, pay attention to the promotional signage when you come in. Anyways, the austere interior didn't deter me from searching for "treasures" in my book.  Although the vinyl section wasn't organized in a customer-friendly manner, we were able to find a "Chicago" (the band) and "the Pointer Sisters" vinyls for $4.32.  Well, hubby failed to confirm the match between the outer sleeve and the record itself.  So "the Pointer Sisters" one was, in actuality, a random R&B group that I've never heard before.  We played it and it was quite alright.  I wasn't too impressed by this Salvation Army thrift store location, but if you happen to be in this area, then stop by and check it out.  I think the neighborhood appeared safe enough during the day, but there is ample paid street parking.  Otherwise, the CTA 63 bus (63rd. St.) passes by if you want to utilize public transportation.

2.description: This Salvation Army is not for everyone. If you're "uncomfortable" with this part of town, by all means stay away & shop more locally. Nothing here to really go out of your way for; I've found an unusually high amount of stained clothing and cracked, unwearable shoes here; the quality of the donations in general isn't that great. It isn't small, but it isn't terribly large. And don't be fooled by the staircase at the side of the store; it isn't accessible to customers. The best section may be the "leather goods" section (still don't understand why SA does this); you may find a decent leather jacket, but expect it to be somewhat inflated in price, SA style. All in all, meh.

0.description: Old school thrift, merchandise turns over a little slowly, prices are generally good. They get interesting pieces of furniture in regularly, be sure to check that out, as well as their cd selection.

3.description: This place is TERRIBLE!!! I ordered 4 italian beefs through grubhub. They only sent two. When I  called to let them know, the guy told me they only had enough for 1 more sandwich. I feel they should have called and let me modify or cancel my order. Instead they sent out a so-called turkey sandwich with hard bread and one slice of store-bought meat. Never again will I order from this place!!!

1.description: This was honestly a really disappointing introduction to Chicago pizza. The restaurant was the only one I could find to deliver so late, after flying in and getting to my hotel around 10:30-11 PM-ish. The delivery charge was $10, the prices were steep, and it took a little over an hour, with a fair bit of difficulty finding where I was.They only had one topping of the two I picked available, and they seem to have still charged me for two toppings even so. That might not be an issue if they had at least doubled that topping--but I could barely find any of it at all. Mostly, it seemed to be gobs of thin sauce on dough with some cheese--all limp, a little greasy, and mostly flavorless. To add insult to injury, the box is just a little too big for a small to fit in this hotel fridge.I really should have just gone to bed hungry instead, or packed a PB&J for the plane. Live and learn, I guess?

2.description: Discussing place. The pizza is gross. No one goes there so no ones in restaurant working. When people call its a guys cellphone. And he leaves from home and runs to the restaurant. I ordered a pizza for pick up. He told me and hour and I went in 45 minutes as soon as I walked up he was rushing in to the pizza place. He let me inside and everything was dirty. I looked in the back and it was so dirty. After seeing tht I didn't wanna eat there. After waiting I got my pizza and cheese sticks but I didn't get marinara sauce. I asked for some and he gives me one with no lid.... So basically I got a cup of sauce in one have pizza in the other. I stared at him and asked for lids. He then said he didn't have any... The handed me a piece of aluminum foil. The pizza was soooooo gross. The sauce was water. Disgusting!!!!

5.description: I was very disappointed when I ordered a Baked Mostaccioli from them, if I'm going to order pasta that I can make myself it's because I want the extras like cheese on top and garlic bread without me doing all the work. The pasta came in a flimsily foam takeout container, usually when I order baked pasta it's in a round foil pan. No garlic bread! Taste was bland. It looked like a doggy bag I take home from a party. I decided to eat some of the pizza we ordered instead and it was just as bad, I have had better frozen pizzas then this. It was just so bland. When I called to order I asked if I was getting a side salad since in the menu it stated I would get one with my pasta and the guy tells me they don't have salad and if I would like fries instead. I took the fries but if I wouldn't have asked about the salad they wouldn't have sent me anything. I hate to give small businesses bad reviews but they have a hot dog stand two doors down, you would think that would be motivation to provide excellent food and service. Prices were pretty ridiculous too that's what makes it worst!

6.description: They MESSED UP my order and gave me an attitude when I called. They guy started shouting at me asking me what I wanted for free! He was a jerk. I told him all I wanted was the correct order he shouted they close in 5 minutes. Then said OMG! As if it was my fault! Needles to say I never got the correct pizza or drink. He simply ignored me.

7.description: Firstly there is no place around me that delivers Breaded Steak Sandwich...so disappointed.This place is terrible...Looking to satisfy my hunger with a breaded steak sandwich but the sandwich was dry and not very filling. The service was terrible and took forever to get my phone even after the friendly service of Grubhub gave them a call and informed me they are mins. away I didn't think it would take another 20 mins. The driver kept calling my phone for directions and when i answered the door he didn't give me my gurbhub receipt or any receipt for that matter. I felt more sorry for his young daughter who had to be about 2 years of age driving with him...first i seen that and come on I dont want to see that again. they call THAT garlic bread?!?! no butter just sprinkled garlic powder on it. They arrive 1 hour and 25 mins after my order. Pizza was near room temp, the 1 liters were warm.This place is a joke and a huge waste of money. Never ordering here again.

8.description: The worst pizza ever.....Loved watching a kids 2-3 years old picking there nose and running around the kitchen area......

0.description: Well food average a little pricey for onion pieces not rings very greasy and ham grinder was good and fries were edible never again will I order here though took hour to go half mile

4.description: It took them an hour and a half to deliver our food... not only was the food cold but also the order was wrong! When I called to let them know I was unhappy with the delivery wait he said to keep waiting, I was put on hold then hung up on.  I called back and they picked up, didn't say a word and hung up again!!! The beaded steak sandwich is a joke and the pasta was garbage. Save your time and money!

0.description: I'm not about to write a bunch of stuff about no Dunkin Donuts .... i think everyone knows what to expect ... you either like them or you don't or you prefer a certain location over others.... Dunkin is what it is. This particular location is ok... the staff are pretty hospitable and the place is normally clean despite being connected to a BP. You will get a couple beggars hanging outside every once in a while.

1.description: This place is a filthy, unorganized, hot mess!  20 minute wait at a drive thru with just one car in front of us? The workers clothes are filthy and so are their finger nails. I guess no one is washing their hands often. Pull up to the window and they are arguing with each other. I'm buying this food for someone else otherwise I would have drove off. At the window they said biscuits would be a 5 minute wait. We waited 15 min once we got to window. They gave us the food so I asked for biscuits since they should have been ready after waiting so long. We were told, no, biscuits still were not ready. Ok. Cool. We pull off. I drop the food off to my dad and head home. He calls and says " I thought you said no biscuits?  They're in the bag."  Really Popeyes?!?!

2.description: Check your order before you leave!!! A 3 piece chicken tender meal is a bit more difficult than it appears for Reed D (cashier). I got a 2 piece and to top it off, maybe it's just me, but my 2 (out of 3) chicken tenders were more like a wing and breast full of bones.

0.description: This popeyes is so unprofessionally. Majority of the cashiers are extremely ghetto, and rude. They take forever to make your food, and they are usually out of all the spicy chicken when i do go to that Popeyes. Most popeyes in the city are bad. The one by 26, and California thats right by the jail is awful tooMy father lives close to that popeyes also.

I've been here numerous times and most of my visits here have been just fine. Today, however, left me a bit peeved. I bought several glass items and after noticing the way the cashier just put them aside, asked him would he be wrapping them in paper or something. He replied no. I asked him why and he said that when they had things to wrap them in, they did but that they didn't today. This is something that should be stated up front.  I would not have gotten the items if I had known that. Also, his demeanor about it, while not nasty, was not customer-oriented, He made no effort to turn around and look for something to substitute for wrap or anything. He closed the register after ringing me up and left. Okay. The kicker is when I was wrapping my glass items in the dish towels, that I am so glad that I purchased, he returns to where I am, picks up a lint brush, which I tell him belongs to me, to which he responds, "I need to see your receipt". Now, perhaps, I am being unreasonable but that irked  me. You just rang me up and you see me getting the items that I just purchased together and you have the nerve to ask me for my receipt, especially after being quite unhelpful? No sir. It just turned me off. I don't know. I still love Dollar Tree. It's good that they have other locations.
